title: Erfaren Dynamics 365-utvecklare med känsla för helhet
description:
**Välkommen till Tromb!**

*Hos oss hittar du en trygg arbetsplats där hållbarhet och inkludering prioriteras högt, och där alla respekteras och synliggörs. Vi arbetar aktivt med en företagskultur som inkluderar psykologisk trygghet, återkommande feedback och personlig utveckling – och vi har som mål en jämlik fördelning på hela bolaget.*

*Låter detta som en miljö där du kan trivas och utvecklas? Välkommen med din ansökan! Om miljön känns rätt men rollbeskrivningen nedan inte passar dig till 100 %, skicka gärna in din ansökan ändå – vi vill gärna träffa dig!*

### **Om rollen**


Har du arbetat med Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM och vill ta nästa kliv i att skapa framtidens lösningar?


Hos oss får du kombinera din djupa tekniska kompetens med helhetstänk i lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Du får ta ett ledande ansvar i design och utveckling av CRM-lösningar byggda på Dynamics 365-plattformen – i nära samarbete med våra kunder och tillsammans med kollegor inom utveckling, UX och verksamhetsutveckling.


Vi söker dig som vill forma moderna CRM-lösningar från idé till implementation. Du trivs med att anpassa och vidareutveckla Dynamics-lösningar, integrera med andra system och ta ansvar för att lösningen hänger ihop tekniskt och funktionellt. Du är med och bygger skräddarsydd funktionalitet genom Power Platform, plugins, integrationer och kod – och vägleder både kunder och team i hur lösningarna kan utvecklas vidare.

### **Om dig som person**

Vi tror att du:

* har mångårig erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE (CRM) och gärna även Power Platform.
* är trygg i att anpassa och konfigurera CRM-lösningar utifrån kundens verksamhet och behov – inklusive utveckling med .NET, C#, plugins och integrationer via t.ex. Azure eller Logic Apps.
* har ett starkt teknikintresse och gillar att arbeta nära kund och användare. Du är van vid att ta ansvar för lösningens helhet – från krav till implementering och vidareutveckling - och är samarbetsinriktad och bidrar gärna med din kunskap i teamet.


Har du dessutom erfarenhet av DevOps, datamodellering eller licensiering inom Dynamics, är det ett plus – men inget krav.

#### **Om tjänsten:**

**Ort:** Stockholm med omnejd.

**Anställningsform**: tillsvidareanställning.

**Tillträde**: enligt överenskommelse.

### **Mer om oss**

Tromb är en dynamisk och innovativ arbetsplats som ständigt söker nya kollegor till vårt team. Vi tror på att rekrytera nyfikna individer och personligheter som kan bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.


Tromb består av cirka 55 entusiaster (i Göteborg, Stockholm, Piteå, Luleå och Skellefteå) med fokus på digital transformation. Vi drivs av att använda teknik för att utveckla design-drivna och användar-centrerade lösningar som ökar effektiviteten och förbättrar vardagen för användare – i slutändan är det resultatet som är viktigast.
  

  

Vi söker värderingsdrivna människor som brinner för att göra skillnad och som delar vår passion för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar – oavsett om du är en erfaren expert inom ditt område eller har en stark vilja att lära och utvecklas. Vi är övertygade om att en inkluderande och stöttande arbetsmiljö, där lärande är en central del av vår kultur, är nyckeln till framgång. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i din roll och samtidigt vara en del av ett starkt team.

  

Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: UX Designer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for an UX Designer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.  

  

**About the role**

  

As a UX designer at Qred, you will be a crucial part of a cross-functional team, developing user-centric digital solutions. Our goal is that our products feel like a natural extension of the user, be it our customers or internal users. In your role, you will be working with user research, wireframing, prototyping, UI design and testing. You will also work closely with your UX colleagues to work on common initiatives and develop the competence. Are you passionate about user experience and have at least a couple of years of experience, this role is probably for you!

**Responsibilities**

* Working as the UX Designer in a cross-functional team, responsible for the user experience as well as the user interface aspects of our products
* Work closely with the other UX designers, where you will work on common initiatives such as the design system and share knowledge and expertise
* Act as an advocate for the user, working closely with the business to balance business goals and user satisfaction
* Conducting UX research and usability testing
* Actively contributing to the design system

**Who we're looking for**

* You have 2+ years of experience as a UX designer, creating user-centric designs that enhance the overall user experience of digital products
* Someone who strongly emphasizes user research and a continuous discovery mindset. The ideal candidate will heavily contribute to these areas.
* You’re used to interacting with users and stakeholders to gather insights and feedback
* Previous experience collaborating closely with developers and product managers
* Experience working with design systems and design tools (we use Figma for UI)
* Experience with UX research and a strong proponent of data driven decisions. You are comfortable defining and maintaining UX metrics.
* Fluent in English (if you have language knowledge of one of our other markets, we'll see it as a big plus)

**Why join us?**


This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.

**One last thing**

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

  

#LI-Hybrid #LI-JL1

title: Graphic Designer till Watma Education
description:
Om rollen
  
  

Som Graphic Designer hos Watma Education blir du vår kreativa motor och visuella expert. Du ansvarar för att ta fram starkt, enhetligt och engagerande innehåll som stärker våra varumärken – i både digitala och tryckta kanaler.
  
Du arbetar med allt från konceptutveckling, copywriting och grafisk formgivning till filmproduktion, fotografering och beställningar av profilmaterial. Rollen kräver hög grad av självständighet – du driver dina egna projekt från idé till färdig leverans, samtidigt som du är en nyckelspelare i marknadsteamets gemensamma arbete.
  
  

Ditt uppdrag
  
Grafisk design & copywriting
  
Skapa visuellt material för webb, sociala medier, kampanjer, tryck och presentationer.
  
Ta fram annonser, broschyrer, roll-ups, broschyrer m.m.
  
Skriva copy till kampanjer, SoMe, annonser och trycksaker.
  
Säkerställa tonalitet, enhetlighet och varumärkesriktighet.
  
  

Film & rörligt innehåll
  
Skapa korta, engagerande filmer för sociala medier och kampanjer.
  
Klippa video, redigera podd, animera och anpassa för olika kanaler.
  
Arbeta i Premiere Pro, After Effects och CapCut.
  
Leda större filmprojekt från manus till färdig produktion.
  
  

Foto & bildredigering
  
Fotografera och filma samt redigera i mindre produktioner.
  
Redigera och retuschera bildmaterial samt film.
  
Säkerställa konsekvent visuell kvalitet i alla kanaler.
  
  

Print & produktion
  
Ta fram trycksaker och ansvara för hela produktionskedjan.
  
Ha kontakt med tryckerier och säkerställa budget, kvalitet och leverans.
  
Hantera beställningar av profilprodukter och webbshoppar.
  
  

Visuell identitet & varumärkeshantering
  
Arbeta utifrån befintliga grafiska riktlinjer och utveckla dessa vid behov.
  
Ansvara för att varumärkets visuella identitet är tydlig, enhetlig och levande.
  
  

För att ansöka vill vi att du har Minst 3 års erfarenhet av en liknande roll.
  
Eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk design, digital design eller liknande.
  
Mycket goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects m.fl.). Du ska också ha erfarenhet av videoproduktion och redigering, CapCut, och grundläggande förståelse för UX/UI.
  
  

För att lyckas i rollen vet vi att du är Självständig, initiativtagande och ansvarstagande – en proaktiv ”doer”, men också kreativ och med hög estetisk känsla.
  
Flexibel, lösningsorienterad och organiserad men också en lagspelare som gärna samarbetar med både kollegor och externa parter.
  
  

Villkor Tjänsten är baserad i Stockholm. Vi arbetar tillsammans från kontoret mitt i stan varje arbetsdag, eftersom vi tror på värdet av det dagliga samarbetet och den gemenskap det skapar.
  
**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare. Provanställning tillämpas.
  
**Tillträde:** Enligt överenskommelse.
  
  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:** 18 maj 2025. Observera att urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Ansök snarast, då annonsen kan stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat.
  
  

Vi strävar efter att erbjuda en fördomsfri och inkluderande rekryteringsprocess. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan, där vi efterfrågar ditt CV men du behöver inte skicka med något personligt brev. För att få veta lite mer om dig vill vi istället att du besvarar ett antal frågor som du hittar om du klickar vidare till ansökan. Om du går vidare efter ansökan kan du komma att få en länk till ett arbetspsykologiskt test. Testerna vi använder tar utgångspunkt i aktuell forskning och fungerar som ett stöd i bedömningen.
  
Våra rekryteringsprocesser består av flera steg, och ofta mer än en intervju. Vi tycker att det är ytterst viktigt att vi ger oss själva den tid som krävs för att få en god bild av varandra - du ska ju välja oss och vi ska välja dig! Emellanåt är det många som söker till en tjänst och då kan processen dra ut något på tiden av den anledningen. Du kan dock vara säker på att vi gör allt vi kan för att hålla dig uppdaterad och återkoppla längs vägen.

title: Senior AI/ML Engineer with NLP experience
description:
**About All Ears**
------------------


All Ears is a global leader in audio and news media monitoring, offering an AI-powered SaaS solution that analyzes brands and trends in real-time across voice and video. Our unparalleled coverage includes TV, radio, podcasts, YouTube, and TikTok. With clients in the Nordics, EU, and the US, our customer base includes organizations like the SHL, Walmart, Netflix, Volvo, and KFC.


Recently, we were featured in Breakit's overview of the Swedish AI scene—highlighting companies that challenge, improve, and redefine their respective industries, one vertical at a time.


In 2024, All Ears surpassed SEK 50 million in revenue and maintains a strong cash position. We’re now focused on growth by doubling down on our technology and product, launching into new languages and markets around the globe.


The company was founded in 2016 by Håkan Waara and Tor Rauden Källstigen and is backed by investors such as Bonnier Capital and Alfvén & Didrikson, who have also invested in companies like Acast, Natural Cycles, Trustly, and Storykit.

**The Role**
------------


As a Senior AI/ML Engineer, you will work in a hands-on, product-oriented role in the Insights Team at All Ears. As part of the team, you will be responsible for turning large amounts of audio and textual data into actionable insights to suit our customers’ needs. You will be responsible for building, and productizing ML-based features in our platform, which is loved and used by customers around the world.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


As a Senior AI/ML Engineer at All Ears, you will:

* Explore and ideate approaches to produce insights from text and audio.
* Develop, deploy, and maintain ML-based features for text analysis.
* Work in a cross-functional team consisting of back-end and front-end developers, UX specialists, and product managers.
* Interact with customers, and internal stakeholders in order to enhance our B2B SaaS product.
* Contribute to high code quality through code reviews, testing, and clear documentation according to best practices.

**Who You Are**
---------------


We believe that you are 5+ years into your career of working with Machine Learning (ML) for building B2B or B2C SaaS-based products, using ML and Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques.


We’re looking for a person who has the perfect mix of practical Software Engineering skills, and experience of operating ML in production. In particular, we’re looking for a candidate with the following experience:

  

* Strong background in ML and NLP.
* Well-versed in modern ML tooling such as Transformers, vector databases, etc.
* Practical knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) in production, both as services via API, and self-hosted deployments.
* Knowledge of Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) such as:
	+ Training and deploying ML models in production, including fine-tuning LLMs.
	+ Operationalizing and automating monitoring, drift detection, and retraining of models.
	+ Evaluating ML models in a practical setting.
* Application of traditional Machine Learning techniques for NLP such as text classification, entity and event detection, and topic modeling.
* A strong Software Engineering background, in particular experienced in building products in a B2B setting.
* Excellent communication skills in oral and written English and Swedish.
* Confident knowledge of our stack, e.g., python, Transformers, FastAPI/Django, microservices and related tools

**What We Offer**
-----------------

* Competitive salary – Because we believe talent should be properly valued.
* Occupational pension – Your future matters just as much as the present.
* Generous vacation – 30 paid vacation days so you can truly recharge. ️
* Strong insurance coverage – Just in case something happens.
  


If you're ready to take on the challenge of building an incredible product for major global companies, send us your CV and a cover letter explaining why you’re the perfect candidate for this role. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!


If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, you can easily reach us at hakan@allears.ai or via the job posting here.

title: Graphic Designer till Watma Education
description:
#### **Om rollen**


Som **Graphic Designer hos Watma Education** blir du vår kreativa motor och visuella expert. Du ansvarar för att ta fram starkt, enhetligt och engagerande innehåll som stärker våra varumärken – i både digitala och tryckta kanaler.


Du arbetar med allt från konceptutveckling, copywriting och grafisk formgivning till filmproduktion, fotografering och beställningar av profilmaterial. Rollen kräver hög grad av självständighet – du driver dina egna projekt från idé till färdig leverans, samtidigt som du är en nyckelspelare i marknadsteamets gemensamma arbete.

### **Ditt uppdrag**


**Grafisk design & copywriting**

* Skapa visuellt material för webb, sociala medier, kampanjer, tryck och presentationer.
* Ta fram annonser, broschyrer, roll-ups, broschyrer m.m.
* Skriva copy till kampanjer, SoMe, annonser och trycksaker.
* Säkerställa tonalitet, enhetlighet och varumärkesriktighet**.**


**Film & rörligt innehåll**

* Skapa korta, engagerande filmer för sociala medier och kampanjer.
* Klippa video, redigera podd, animera och anpassa för olika kanaler.
* Arbeta i Premiere Pro, After Effects och CapCut.
* Leda större filmprojekt från manus till färdig produktion**.**


**Foto & bildredigering**

* Fotografera och filma samt redigera i mindre produktioner.
* Redigera och retuschera bildmaterial samt film.
* Säkerställa konsekvent visuell kvalitet i alla kanaler**.**

**Print & produktion**

* Ta fram trycksaker och ansvara för hela produktionskedjan.
* Ha kontakt med tryckerier och säkerställa budget, kvalitet och leverans.
* Hantera beställningar av profilprodukter och webbshoppar**.**


**Visuell identitet & varumärkeshantering**

  

* Arbeta utifrån befintliga grafiska riktlinjer och utveckla dessa vid behov.
* Ansvara för att varumärkets visuella identitet är tydlig, enhetlig och levande.

### **För att ansöka vill vi att du har**


 Minst 3 års erfarenhet av en liknande roll.


 Eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk design, digital design eller liknande.


Mycket goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects m.fl.). Du ska också ha erfarenhet av videoproduktion och redigering, CapCut, och grundläggande förståelse för UX/UI.

### **För att lyckas i rollen vet vi att du är**


 Självständig, initiativtagande och ansvarstagande – en proaktiv ”doer”, men också kreativ och med hög estetisk känsla.


 Flexibel, lösningsorienterad och organiserad men också en lagspelare som gärna samarbetar med både kollegor och externa parter.

### **Villkor**

* Tjänsten är baserad i Stockholm. Vi arbetar tillsammans från kontoret mitt i stan varje arbetsdag, eftersom vi tror på värdet av det dagliga samarbetet och den gemenskap det skapar.
* Anställningsform: Tillsvidare. Provanställning tillämpas.
* Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse.


Sista ansökningsdatum: 18 maj 2025. Observera att urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Ansök snarast, då annonsen kan stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat.

 *Vi strävar efter att erbjuda en fördomsfri och inkluderande rekryteringsprocess. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan, där vi efterfrågar ditt CV men du behöver inte skicka med något personligt brev. För att få veta lite mer om dig vill vi istället att du besvarar ett antal frågor som du hittar om du klickar vidare till ansökan. Om du går vidare efter ansökan kan du komma att få en länk till ett arbetspsykologiskt test. Testerna vi använder tar utgångspunkt i aktuell forskning och fungerar som ett stöd i bedömningen.*

*Våra rekryteringsprocesser består av flera steg, och ofta mer än en intervju. Vi tycker att det är ytterst viktigt att vi ger oss själva den tid som krävs för att få en god bild av varandra - du ska ju välja oss och vi ska välja dig! Emellanåt är det många som söker till en tjänst och då kan processen dra ut något på tiden av den anledningen. Du kan dock vara säker på att vi gör allt vi kan för att hålla dig uppdaterad och återkoppla längs vägen.*

title: UX Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a UX Architect to focus on the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.


We’re shaping the future of user experience across Ericsson’s most complex systems—RAN Architect, from radio networks to cloud-native solutions. As we scale our design impact across technology domains, we’re looking for a UX Architect to help us drive clarity, structure, and strategy in how we build design for scale and complexity.


As a UX Architect you will focus on the structural design of user experiences across complex systems and digital products. You will operate at a broader scale—defining how content, navigation, and functionality are organized across the entire product ecosystem.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Architect UX across systems: Organize and structure content in ways that are intuitive and easy to navigate, using sitemaps, taxonomies, and content hierarchies.
* Experience Mapping & Flow Design: Drive the creation of UX frameworks, shared principles, and reusable patterns that improve coherence, reduce duplication, and enable sustainable design growth across product areas.
* Facilitate alignment and strategy: Work with design and non-design stakeholders to bridge user needs with platform capabilities, balancing immediate goals with long-term UX quality and consistency.
* Champion information architecture: Define and evolve models that support intuitive navigation, scalable workflows, and clarity in high-density, enterprise-level UIs.
* Enable collaboration and governance: Support Ericsson Design system integration, General Product Requirements, handoff documentation, and decision rationale to guide implementation and ensure UX intent is preserved.
* Elevate design maturity: Help define what “good” looks like across user experience architecture, bringing in research, systems thinking, and strategic design to support design-led ways of working.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* A systems thinker with a passion for structuring UX in large-scale, technical environments.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity, building frameworks that bring clarity and enable action.
* You collaborate naturally across disciplines and advocate for user value while understanding technical constraints.
* You have experience with design systems, large information structures, and coordinating across multiple teams or products.
* We’re looking for someone who has…
* 5+ years in UX Architecture, Interaction Design, or UX roles
* Experience designing for enterprise or technical domains
* Strong collaboration skills with product managers, system engineers, developers, and architects, technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools: Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.
* Familiarity with Ericsson technologies or telecom systems is a plus - but curiosity and adaptability matter more.

 **How to apply:**

  

We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior user-experience (UX) designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.


This position requires a person with experience in understanding our business requirements and any technical limitations and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes. The UX designer will also be encouraged to craft the overall functionality of the product, and to ensure an outstanding user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Share a passion for the value of UX and Human-centered design across various user interfaces by working with an interdisciplinary team.
* To achieve higher quality, lower costs, and shorter time to release, keep up to date with UX processes, tools and standard methodologies.
* Engage in all phases of product development and implementation with system engineers, business stakeholders, and product managers.
* Produce materials that help the team understand the recommendations, storyboards, wireframes, journey maps, concept, and prototype designs, etc.
* Design and refine interactions based on the best prototyping options and user testing, including synthesis and incorporation of feedback.
* Use the accurate component from the Ericsson design system library for appropriate features and consistent user experience.
* Work with developers to understand the opportunities and limitations of the technology that will be used to express the design solution, document requirements, and explain the expectations around an interaction.
* Support your teammates' growth by participating in UX meetings and collaborative design reviews

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in an UX-related field of study or equivalent experience.
* Working experience in UX design (information architecture, interaction design and visual design).
* Flexibility in working both independently and collaboratively
* The ability to independently research and resolve issues using appropriate resources.
* Strong visual design skills and a keen sense of effective UI.
* Skilled in technical documentation, generating reports, design assessments, and leading scoping and review sessions. Experienced in following and contributing to technical processes.
* Extensive experience crafting user flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, user interface designs and high-quality final visual comps.
* Experience conducting usability tests.
* Having delivered designs to engineering teams and proven track record of presenting to and influencing stakeholders and senior management.
* Excellent experience in coordinating development, status, and delivery of projects using project management skills and tools.
* Experience in B2B environments is considered a strong advantage.

 **How to apply:**

  

We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. title: Senior Service Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

We at the Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior Service Designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.  

We’re seeking a strategic individual with experience working in multidisciplinary teams, applying human-centered design principles. By deepening our understanding of how customers interact with our systems and services, we aim to continuously improve our software solutions and service experiences.


Your area of expertise may be in a specific field, but your strength is thinking strategically, solving problems creatively, and working collaboratively. The role entails conducting research and projects inside R&D to understand user needs, build compelling design experiences, and assist organizations with implementation.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Lead and drive user-centered design initiatives across complex, technical telecom software domains—collaborating closely with product managers, system engineers, and developers to ensure the UX perspective is integrated throughout.
* Facilitate and participate in design thinking workshops, co-creation sessions, and stakeholder dialogues to align on goals and unlock opportunities across teams and time zones.
* Conduct and analyze research through interviews, desk research, and global user engagement to uncover actionable insights and support iterative prototyping.
* Translate complex technical documentation and abstract ideas into user-friendly, clear, and actionable design concepts.
* Create thoughtful, human-centric experiences across service touchpoints by working in cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams.
* Use storytelling and visual communication to share insights, journey maps, and concept proposals with technical and non-technical audiences alike.
* Develop design content, artifacts, and specifications in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and other tools—supporting both local projects and broader business area collaborations.
* Balance multiple ongoing studies and projects, bringing structure, clarity, and a user-focused mindset to everything from workshop facilitation to final delivery.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Human-centered design/service design experience
* Degree in Interaction Design, Service Design, Human-Computer Interaction, UX Design, or related field.
* Working experience in a design consultancy or equivalent position.
* Ability to work independently on key workstreams in large projects or take ownership of small ones
* Organizational skills and ability to lead multiple projects.
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Professional in current software design practices.

title: UX/UI Designer  Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create marketing content and be a part of taking our product to market.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience with Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: UX Designer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for an UX Designer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a UX designer at Qred, you will be a crucial part of a cross-functional team, developing user-centric digital solutions. Our goal is that our products feel like a natural extension of the user, be it our customers or internal users. In your role, you will be working with user research, wireframing, prototyping, UI design and testing. You will also work closely with your UX colleagues to work on common initiatives and develop the competence. Are you passionate about user experience and have at least a couple of years of experience, this role is probably for you!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Working as the UX Designer in a cross-functional team, responsible for the user experience as well as the user interface aspects of our products
* Work closely with the other UX designers, where you will work on common initiatives such as the design system and share knowledge and expertise
* Act as an advocate for the user, working closely with the business to balance business goals and user satisfaction
* Conducting UX research and usability testing
* Actively contributing to the design system


**Who We're Looking For**
* You have 2+ years of experience as a UX designer, creating user-centric designs that enhance the overall user experience of digital products
* Someone who strongly emphasizes user research and a continuous discovery mindset. The ideal candidate will heavily contribute to these areas.
* You’re used to interacting with users and stakeholders to gather insights and feedback
* Previous experience collaborating closely with developers and product managers
* Experience working with design systems and design tools (we use Figma for UI)
* Experience with UX research and a strong proponent of data driven decisions. You are comfortable defining and maintaining UX metrics.
* Fluent in English (if you have language knowledge of one of our other markets, we'll see it as a big plus)


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: UX/UI designer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Be a part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us at PostNord. Join the UX design team in Stockholm!
   

  

 Join the UX team at PostNord and help shape outstanding customer journeys with a user-centered mindset. As a UX/UI designer, you’ll collaborate with fellow designers within a dedicated user segment, working on multiple services to create seamless and impactful experiences.
   

  

 Join us
   

  

 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently owns the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm
 ***.***
 We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week.
   

  

 Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

 ,
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a UX/UI designer that wants to be a key player and take ownership. You will work closely with business, product owners, developers and other UX designers and make sure we build the best customer journeys.
   

  

 As a person, we believe that you are full of initiative and solution oriented. You have good communication skills and thrive when you get to work both practically and close to our users. You are no stranger with facilitating meetings or workshops and visualizing requirements. You have great knowledge and experience in designing for web and native applications for iOS/Android.
   

  

 You have a great personal drive and adapt efficiently to new information and insights. Like us, you value teamwork and building great solutions together.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

* Relevant education in UX design, interaction design, service design or equivalent field.
* Minimum 3 years of work experience as a UX/UI designer
* Facilitation skills and able to take ownership and get things done
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services in Figma
* The ability to analyze and design user flows based on insights collected via interviews and other mediums such as Hotjar/Google Analytics
* Experience in designing user interfaces for both web and native apps
* Understands graphic design and typography
* Understands designing for accessibility and WCAG requirements
* Experience in planning and conducting user tests
* Fluent Swedish and English


 Job Responsibilities
   

  

* Conducting user research, both qualitative and quantitative, as well as analyzing and presenting insights to revenant product teams and the whole department
* Analyzing and following up on user research
* Designing overall user flows and interfaces for our digital services on the web
* Working closely with product owners, other designers and other stakeholders within PostNord
* You’ll be responsible in aligning your work with other UX designers and user segments, on how it might affect PostNord’s multiple customer journeys.


**We offer you**
* A great team, you are part of a team with a focus on creating amazing customer-facing solutions at Postnord.
* Agile is our way of working, we have weekly’s, daily's, refinement meetings and sprint retros.
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* To be part of a large organization with endless development opportunities for you as a UX designer and individual.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

**Apply**
  

  

  

  

 What are you waiting for? Send your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, email sonja.prest@postnord.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a passionate and skilled UX/UI Designer. At Avalanche Studios Group you will work with some of the industry’s most exciting technology and talented individuals. As a UX/UI Designer, you will be collaborating with other disciplines & product owners to ensure quality, usability, consistency, and compliance across all deliverables. You will create deliverables including but not limited to: user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity designs and prototypes to communicate vision and strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who has a fluency in a variety of design crafts (UX, UI, Design Systems, Prototyping) as well as expert proficiency in industry standard design tools. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of inclusive design practices and is capable and a strong understanding of best practices in open world action gameplay design UX.
   

  

 To be considered for this role you need to submit a portfolio showcasing your skills and examples of your work.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Apply conceptual thinking while considering user-needs, experience goals and technical feasibility
* Work closely with development teams to ensure that design specifications are met and implemented
* Work with project managers to fill out design criteria in JIRA and ensure requirements are outlined for development
* Regularly seek out and incorporate feedback into iterative UX/UI improvements
* Collaborate and communicate regularly with other discipline partners
* Be an advocate for Player-First, Fun-First, thinking within design


**Who You Are**
* Several years of in-depth UX/UI design experience in development teams within the gaming industry
* Ability to create UI assets to releasable quality
* Strategic design thinking, processes and design system related work experience
* Capable of managing multiple priorities simultaneously
* Understands and advocates for the importance of data-driven decisions
* A drive for designing engaging game mechanics while reducing player frustration and unnecessary complexity.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and experience articulating design strategy
* Continually strive to exceed expectations


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Design Manager, Design System
description:
**Company Description**
 Commercial Development & Growth is a global function within the H&M brand and our mission is to set and deliver on the global customer experience strategy to strengthen our brand and enable profitable sales. Together we develop, expand and optimise all sales channels while securing conditions for efficient operations leveraged by tech and strong collaboration across the organisation.
   

  

 Our function plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan through an elevated, inspirational, and relevant shopping experience that is centered around our product and provides competitive convenience for our customers.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about design systems and eager to drive both efficiency and brand excellence at scale? As our Design System Design Manager, you will work with the existing Product Manager and Engineering Manager to bring the design perspective and together lead the Design System team forward strategically and operationally across H&M’s global digital product ecosystem — including web, mobile apps, and internal tools.
   

  

 You’ll lead a team of designers, foster cross-functional alignment, and play a key role in shaping consistent, accessible, and high-quality digital experiences across all customer touchpoints.
   

  

 You will be part of the
 **Digital Experience Design team** 
 within the
 **Commercial Development & Growth function** 
 , working closely with product managers, engineers, brand and creative teams, and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
* The Design Manager will work with the existing Product Manager and Engineering Manager roles to bring the design perspective and together lead the Design System team forward.
* Maintain and evolve the design system, ensuring it meets scalability, efficiency, and brand alignment requirements together with team leadership.
* Define and implement governance models, contribution processes, and adoption guidelines to manage system integrity together with team leadership.
* Lead, mentor, and grow a team of designers, fostering craft excellence and team development.
* Partner with brand and creative development teams to embed visual identity, motion, and interaction principles into the system.
* Collaborate with Digital Experience Design Directors to align system development with governance, operations, and long-term scalability strategies.
* Work with Digital Experience Design Leads to ensure UI/UX quality, accessibility, and consistent interaction patterns.
* Partner with engineering teams to ensure seamless implementation and maintenance of system components.
* Contribute to and maintain robust documentation, component libraries, and design tokens to support effective usage and scalability.
* Develop and provide onboarding, training, and advocacy initiatives to promote system adoption across teams.
* Establish and manage versioning, release planning, and system lifecycle processes to ensure sustainable evolution.
* Gather, analyze, and act on feedback from design, product, and engineering teams to continuously improve the system.
* Ensure accessibility and inclusive design principles (e.g., WCAG, ARIA) are embedded in all system components.
* Define and track key metrics to measure the system’s performance, adoption, and impact on design consistency and delivery efficiency.
* Participate in cross-functional working groups to align priorities and foster strong collaboration across disciplines.
* Represent the design system team in design leadership discussions, advocating for scalable and strategic design solutions.
* Remain close to execution by guiding component development and troubleshooting system-related issues alongside your team.


**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this role, you bring a blend of technical expertise, design thinking, and people leadership. You thrive at the intersection of systems, creativity, and collaboration — ensuring our design system is not only functional but inspiring, scalable, and effective.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* Extensive experience in UI/UX design and design systems within digital product organizations.
* Deep knowledge of design system frameworks, component-based design, and front-end principles.
* Strong proficiency in tools like Figma, Sketch, Storybook, and front-end frameworks such as React or Vue.
* Proven leadership experience with mentoring, coaching, and developing high-performing teams.
* Hands-on experience building, scaling, and managing design systems in cross-functional environments.
* Strong collaboration experience with product managers, engineers, brand and creative development teams.
* Expertise in governance, structured processes, and system contribution management.
* In-depth knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, ARIA) and inclusive design practices.
* Excellent documentation, facilitation, and communication skills.
* A track record of driving design system adoption, ownership, and culture change across teams.
* Experience using qualitative and quantitative data to guide decision-making and improve system impact.


**Additional Information**
 Are you ready to lead and make a meaningful impact?  Please upload your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than April 27.  Interviews will take place continuously, so don’t wait—submit your application today if you’re interested! Kindly note that, due to GDPR regulations, we can only accept applications submitted through our career page.
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position, based at Head Office in Stockholm, Sweden. You will report to
 **Karolina Boremalm, Head of Digital Experience Design** 
 . For questions about the role, please contact Zoran Pesic at zoran.pesic@hm.com
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: UX Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a UX Architect to focus on the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 We’re shaping the future of user experience across Ericsson’s most complex systems—RAN Architect, from radio networks to cloud-native solutions. As we scale our design impact across technology domains, we’re looking for a UX Architect to help us drive clarity, structure, and strategy in how we build design for scale and complexity.
   

  

 As a UX Architect you will focus on the structural design of user experiences across complex systems and digital products. You will operate at a broader scale—defining how content, navigation, and functionality are organized across the entire product ecosystem.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Architect UX across systems: Organize and structure content in ways that are intuitive and easy to navigate, using sitemaps, taxonomies, and content hierarchies.
* Experience Mapping & Flow Design: Drive the creation of UX frameworks, shared principles, and reusable patterns that improve coherence, reduce duplication, and enable sustainable design growth across product areas.
* Facilitate alignment and strategy: Work with design and non-design stakeholders to bridge user needs with platform capabilities, balancing immediate goals with long-term UX quality and consistency.
* Champion information architecture: Define and evolve models that support intuitive navigation, scalable workflows, and clarity in high-density, enterprise-level UIs.
* Enable collaboration and governance: Support Ericsson Design system integration, General Product Requirements, handoff documentation, and decision rationale to guide implementation and ensure UX intent is preserved.
* Elevate design maturity: Help define what “good” looks like across user experience architecture, bringing in research, systems thinking, and strategic design to support design-led ways of working.


**The skills you bring:**
* A systems thinker with a passion for structuring UX in large-scale, technical environments.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity, building frameworks that bring clarity and enable action.
* You collaborate naturally across disciplines and advocate for user value while understanding technical constraints.
* You have experience with design systems, large information structures, and coordinating across multiple teams or products.
* We’re looking for someone who has…
* 5+ years in UX Architecture, Interaction Design, or UX roles
* Experience designing for enterprise or technical domains
* Strong collaboration skills with product managers, system engineers, developers, and architects, technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools: Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.
* Familiarity with Ericsson technologies or telecom systems is a plus - but curiosity and adaptability matter more.


**How to apply:**
 We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765270

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We at Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior user-experience (UX) designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 This position requires a person with experience in understanding our business requirements and any technical limitations and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes. The UX designer will also be encouraged to craft the overall functionality of the product, and to ensure an outstanding user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Share a passion for the value of UX and Human-centered design across various user interfaces by working with an interdisciplinary team.
* To achieve higher quality, lower costs, and shorter time to release, keep up to date with UX processes, tools and standard methodologies.
* Engage in all phases of product development and implementation with system engineers, business stakeholders, and product managers.
* Produce materials that help the team understand the recommendations, storyboards, wireframes, journey maps, concept, and prototype designs, etc.
* Design and refine interactions based on the best prototyping options and user testing, including synthesis and incorporation of feedback.
* Use the accurate component from the Ericsson design system library for appropriate features and consistent user experience.
* Work with developers to understand the opportunities and limitations of the technology that will be used to express the design solution, document requirements, and explain the expectations around an interaction.
* Support your teammates' growth by participating in UX meetings and collaborative design reviews


**The skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree in an UX-related field of study or equivalent experience.
* Working experience in UX design (information architecture, interaction design and visual design).
* Flexibility in working both independently and collaboratively
* The ability to independently research and resolve issues using appropriate resources.
* Strong visual design skills and a keen sense of effective UI.
* Skilled in technical documentation, generating reports, design assessments, and leading scoping and review sessions. Experienced in following and contributing to technical processes.
* Extensive experience crafting user flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, user interface designs and high-quality final visual comps.
* Experience conducting usability tests.
* Having delivered designs to engineering teams and proven track record of presenting to and influencing stakeholders and senior management.

title: Grafisk designer - LIA/praktik
description:
**Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla.**
 Om rollen & teamet
   

  

 Vi söker dig som älskar att skapa visuellt säljande material, vare sig det är till ett nyhetsbrev eller en annons på Instagram. Du är är full av driv och har en vilja att lära dig allt som krävs för att bli en riktigt vass grafisk designer. Som grafisk designer på Apohem blir du en del av Brand-teamet och hela marknadsavdelningen. Du får möjlighet att vara delaktig i vårt dagliga arbete och lära dig massor av nytt. Du blir samtidigt en viktig del i att lyfta Apohems visuella uttryck till nya nivåer.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen är du en person med öga för detaljer och som hjälper till där det behövs. Ditt fokus är på produktion och att bli självgående i Adobe Suite, men du är inte heller rädd att komma med egna idéer och initiativ. Det är viktigt att du kan jobba självständigt, även om du kommer få stöttning av vårt designteam.
   

  

 Du kommer göra det här (och säkert mer):
   

  

* Producera content och material (rörligt, stillbild) till våra digitala kanaler såsom webb, sociala medier och e-mail
* Jobba med kreativa koncept och kampanjer som tas ut i våra kanaler
* Producera Ai-material som linjerar med Apohems varumärke
* Fotografera produkter till våra olika kanaler tillsammans med vår grafiska designer


**Du Får**
* Nära stöttning och handledning av vårt designteam (Grafisk designer och Art Director & Motion Creative)
* En inblick hur det är att jobba på en marknadsavdelning, på en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-commerce företag


**Vi Vill Att Du**
* Studerar grafisk design och har en praktik/LIA period.
* Har jobbat i Adobe Suite tidigare (Framförallt Photoshop, Illustrator och After Effects), men vårt designteam finns alltid där för att stötta dig.
* Är en ‘doer’ och van att hålla ett högt tempo med många bollar i luften.
* Är bra på att både ge/ta feedback.
* Är prestigelös och redo att ta dig an vad som helst.
* Är initiativtagande och ser möjligheter snarare än problem.
* Är nyfiken och hungrig på att lära dig nya saker.
* Är kreativ och har ett öga för detaljer


 Att jobba på Apohem
   

  

 Som Sveriges snabbast växande apotek med snart en miljard i omsättning och hundratals medarbetare är det längesedan vi var en start-up. Även om vi såklart har våra processer och riktlinjer, skulle vi aldrig någonsin låta oss fastna i byråkrati som andra storbolag. Vi har vårt startup-mindset kvar, är alltid hungriga och vill snabbt framåt.
   

  

 Den snabba tillväxten vi har kräver djärva medarbetare som tar modiga beslut, som vill göra saker bättre och inte räds förändringar. Hos oss är varje person sin egen ledare och tar ansvar för att utveckla både sig själv, sitt område och Apohem. Men vi gör alla samma resa – vi gör det ihop. Och det råder inga som helst frågetecken kring vart vi är på väg. Det är nästan så att man blir otålig. Tillsammans har vi byggt Apohem på de fundamenten – en arbetsplats där vi vinner tillsammans, vet vart vi ska och alltid är taggade!
   

  

 Låter det spännande?
   

  

 Sök nu! Praktikperioden börjar så snart som möjligt under våren 2025 med hänsyn till din utbildningsplan och varar minst 8 veckor. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-04-30.
   

  

 Om Apohem
   

  

 Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla. Det ska inte vara dyrt eller krångligt att ta hand om sig själv och dem man tycker om. Därför erbjuder vi över 20 000 handplockade produkter, tillsammans med inspiration, vägledning och personlig rådgivning från farmaceuter, hudterapeuter och kundrådgivare.
   

  

 Apohem ingår i Axel Johnson-koncernen och är sedan 2019 ett fullskaligt apotek. Apohem är för tredje året i rad en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-handlare och Sveriges snabbast växande apotek.
   

  

 Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla. Det ska inte vara dyrt eller krångligt att ta hand om sig själv och dem man tycker om. Därför erbjuder vi över 20 000 handplockade produkter, tillsammans med inspiration, vägledning och personlig rådgivning från farmaceuter, hudterapeuter och kundrådgivare.
   

  

 Apohem ingår i Axel Johnson-koncernen och är sedan 2019 ett fullskaligt apotek. Apohem är för tredje året i rad en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-handlare och Sveriges snabbast växande apotek.

title: Senior Service Designer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We at the Design and User Experience department within Business Area Networks are now looking for a Senior Service Designer to contribute to the latest innovations in Ericsson’s product portfolio.
   

  

 We’re seeking a strategic individual with experience working in multidisciplinary teams, applying human-centered design principles. By deepening our understanding of how customers interact with our systems and services, we aim to continuously improve our software solutions and service experiences.
   

  

 Your area of expertise may be in a specific field, but your strength is thinking strategically, solving problems creatively, and working collaboratively. The role entails conducting research and projects inside R&D to understand user needs, build compelling design experiences, and assist organizations with implementation.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Lead and drive user-centered design initiatives across complex, technical telecom software domains—collaborating closely with product managers, system engineers, and developers to ensure the UX perspective is integrated throughout.
* Facilitate and participate in design thinking workshops, co-creation sessions, and stakeholder dialogues to align on goals and unlock opportunities across teams and time zones.
* Conduct and analyze research through interviews, desk research, and global user engagement to uncover actionable insights and support iterative prototyping.
* Translate complex technical documentation and abstract ideas into user-friendly, clear, and actionable design concepts.
* Create thoughtful, human-centric experiences across service touchpoints by working in cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams.
* Use storytelling and visual communication to share insights, journey maps, and concept proposals with technical and non-technical audiences alike.
* Develop design content, artifacts, and specifications in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and other tools—supporting both local projects and broader business area collaborations.
* Balance multiple ongoing studies and projects, bringing structure, clarity, and a user-focused mindset to everything from workshop facilitation to final delivery.


**The skills you bring:**
* Human-centered design/service design experience
* Degree in Interaction Design, Service Design, Human-Computer Interaction, UX Design, or related field.
* Working experience in a design consultancy or equivalent position.
* Ability to work independently on key workstreams in large projects or take ownership of small ones
* Organizational skills and ability to lead multiple projects.
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Professional in current software design practices.


**How to apply:**
 We ask that you showcase your portfolio to demonstrate your ability to create solutions and digital experiences that strengthen the connection between users and the product. If you consider yourself a strong designer but haven’t had the time to prepare an online portfolio—don’t hesitate to apply. You’ll have the opportunity to present your work during the interview process. We’re recruiting continuously, so don’t wait for the final date—send in your application early to make sure you’re considered. Last date to apply 15th of May 2025.

title: Product Designer – Consumer Facing team (Bangkok Based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****Role in the Consumer facing team:****
 This team aims to create the smoothest checkout experience for users by offering personalized payment methods and scaling the experience across other funnels like flights and activities. The Growth & Retention team focuses on attracting new users while retaining existing ones by leveraging competitive pricing, rewards, and programs to enhance user engagement and loyalty.
   

  

**Experience Requirements & Role Expectations:**
* 5+ years of full-time experience as a UX/Interaction designer for digital or web-based products; in-house designer experience highly preferred
* Has experience of managing multiple stakeholders with agile development process
* Proficient in creating wireframes, UX design tools and prototyping
* A strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your design thinking, process, and solutions as it relates to web-based products or mobile applications that with complexities
* Good communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills in English
* Good visual skills, familiarity with components usage


 The Product Designer is an experienced problem solver for the areas with high complexity. He/she will work closely with Product stakeholders to collaborate and execute on the product team’s roadmap and milestones.
   

  

 The Designer also possesses domain knowledge and expertise of the products or initiatives, to co-create future partner-centric product strategy or roadmap with your stakeholders. He/she will lead by creating alignment, telling compelling and persuasive stories to illustrate hotel users’ problems connected with enterprise business journey, clearly articulate design decisions, driving and pushing for optimal UX solutions to stakeholders and influence the enterprise businessfor the longer term visions.
   

  

**Role Responsibility:**
* You will deliver hands-on design solutions for moderately complex enterprise business scenarios and well-defined business problems, aligning with property partners’ vision and our business goals
* You will actively engage in research and collaborate with our researcher to evaluate the impact of proposed solutions, driving improvements and refinements towards achieving desired outcomes in property partner-facing products
* You will acquire deep domain knowledge in OTA (Online Travel Agency) business through daily collaboration with product leaders, analyzing research insights, and working closely with product stakeholders
* You will represent ‘Agoda Design’ by advocating user-centric design principles and engaging with external property partner touchpoints
* You will collaborate with product stakeholders to drive continuous discovery processes, validating and shaping ideas to experiment with and build upon, thereby influencing enterprise product strategy and roadmap


**Join us in shaping the future of travel experiences at Agoda!**
 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul #bangkok
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

title: Product Designer – Rocket Travel by Agoda (Bangkok Based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

 Join Rocket Travel by Agoda (RTA), the B2B division of Agoda and Booking Holdings. We partner with leading global brands to scale Agoda’s travel technology to their customers. We do this by designing and building innovative loyalty travel platforms and white-label solutions.
   

  

 As part of our team, you’ll create high-quality designs that shape the future of B2B travel, driving business growth, partner success, and user engagement.
   

  

**What Product Design Looks Like at Rocket Travel by Agoda (RTA)**
 As a product designer at RTA, you’ll own the design of both consumer-facing features and agent-facing tools for our B2B travel sites. You’ll collaborate with the product and engineering teams responsible for these products, as well as stakeholders who work directly with our partners. In addition, you’ll work with designers and researchers across B2B and B2C teams, often collaborating with colleagues in different regions. Your contributions will help deliver innovative white-label travel solutions and create seamless, engaging experiences for our partners, agents and customers.
   

  

**Role in the Team:**
 We are looking for a Product Designer with exceptional standards of design quality, expertise in UI and design systems, and strong communication skills to support our diverse team of stakeholders. The primary goal of this role is to own the design of customer-facing funnels and the agent-facing experience within RTA, which includes:
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Build and manage comprehensive user journeys for our whitelabel products, collaborating closely with designers, PM’s and engineers, and actively engaging in feedback sessions to drive high-quality designs
* Adapt our agent-facing platform for unique whitelabel loyalty products
* Possess a deep knowledge of Figma and design systems, including auto-layout, variables, color tokens, and design system components
* Build scalable Figma templates that allow us to work efficiently
* Contribute to partner launches
* Contribute to the evolution of RTA’s design system
* Conduct industry benchmarking across travel and loyalty platforms, summarizing key trends and insights
* Identify opportunities to improve design workflows and processes
* Align with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, partner and user-centric solutions while meeting business objectives
* Manage stakeholders with strong communication


**Qualities We Value in Designers:**
* Strong Visual and UX/UI Skills: Experience designing across multiple platforms, creating user flows, and delivering high-fidelity solutions
* Systematic Thinking and Design Systems Expertise: Ability to think systematically and contribute to design systems that ensure consistency, scalability, and efficiency
* Embody curiosity, community, and accountability. We live and build products by these values every day
* Effective Communication: Ability to clearly articulate design concepts and solutions, fostering collaboration and understanding among team members. Contribute to a culture of feedback by being open to giving and receiving it
