 Som senior konsult på B3 Elevate blir du en nyckelspelare i våra leveranser och har en central roll i våra kunders transformationsresor. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Leda och stödja kunder i strategiska förändrings- och utvecklingsprojekt
* Driva implementeringar av ny teknik och nya arbetssätt
* Verka i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och IT, med fokus på att skapa långsiktigt affärsvärde
* Ansvara för agila projekt inom system- och verksamhetsutveckling med koppling till Dynamics 365
* Motivera och coacha kollegor samt projektdeltagare för att säkerställa framdrift och engagemang


**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som senior projekt- och förändringsledare får du ansvar och frihet att undanröja hinder och driva utveckling framåt. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Leda och ansvara för projekt- och förändringsinitiativ från planering till genomförande och uppföljning
* Förankra och kommunicera förändringar på alla nivåer i organisationen
* Etablera, genomföra och följa upp projektplaner och mål
* Koordinera resurser och säkerställa leveranser i enlighet med krav och tidsramar
* Planera och facilitera workshops och utbildningar för att säkerställa förståelse, engagemang och förändring
* Rapportera framdrift och resultat till styrgrupper och övriga intressenter
* Ansvara för ekonomisk budgetering och uppföljning


**Erfarenhet och kompetens**
 Du är en trygg, kommunikativ och engagerad lagspelare med förmåga att självständigt driva komplexa projekt och förändringsinitiativ. Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* 5–10 års relevant erfarenhet inom projekt- och förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av att leda digitala transformationsprojekt, gärna inom Dynamics 365
* Du är analytisk, kreativ och har god förmåga att lösa problem självständigt
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Certifiering inom agila arbetssätt (t.ex. SAFe) eller förändringsledning (t.ex. PROSCI) är meriterande


**Vårt erbjudande**
 B3 Elevate är ett specialistbolag inom B3 Consulting Group med fokus på Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Med våra 20+ konsulter har vi kapacitet att leverera digital transformation från strategi till förvaltning. Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Hög beläggningsgrad och stora möjligheter till professionell utveckling
* Ett högt inflytande och nära samarbete med beställare och beslutsfattare
* Tillgång till ett internt forum för verksamhetsexperter, där vi delar erfarenheter och löser utmaningar tillsammans
* En attraktiv lönemodell och konkurrenskraftiga förmåner
* Flexibla arbetstider för en hållbar balans mellan arbete och privatliv
* En trygg arbetsgivare inom B3 Consulting Group, en börsnoterad koncern med hög medarbetarnöjdhet


 B3 har över 1000 konsulter inom olika expertområden och orter, med huvudkontor i moderna lokaler vid Hötorget.

title: Infrastrukturarkitekt
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala samhälle? Nu har du chansen att kliva ombord på vår resa mot en innovativ och digitaliserad framtid, där vi inte bara stärker it-tjänster och drift för våra egna system utan även för andra statliga myndigheter. Vi bygger en ny dynamisk enhet full av kompetens och engagemang, och vi vill att du ska vara med och göra skillnad. Är du redo att vara en del av något stort? Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som infrastukturarkitekt hos oss får du en central roll i att driva den tekniska utvecklingen framåt. Du kommer att arbeta med infrastrukturarkitektur, vara länken mellan teknik och verksamhet samt vägleda utvecklingsteam och beslutsfattare mot framtidens lösningar. Ditt fokus kommer ligga på infrastrukturtjänster, där du blir en viktig del av vårt arkitektteam inom Stödjande Tekniska Tjänster (STT). Du trivs med att växla mellan strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt arbete, och du har förmågan att både se helheten och dyka ner i tekniska detaljer. Din insats kommer direkt bidra till Skatteverkets övergång till en informationsdriven och digitaliserad verksamhet.
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och i tätt samarbete mellan it och verksamheten för att skapa utvecklingsvärdeströmmar. Vår tekniska miljö är bred och i ständig utveckling, med steg mot moderna lösningar som privata molntjänster, mikrotjänstarkitektur och containerteknik. På vår förändringsresa hanterar vi både nya och äldre teknologier, vilket ställer krav på att du behärskar flera arkitekturstilar parallellt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling. Du har pålitliga, ödmjuka och kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* högskoleutbildning inom it som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för rollen
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom infrastrukturarkitektur
* aktuell erfarenhet av privata mjukvarudefinierade datacenter (SDDC)
* grundläggande kunskap i modern säkerhetsarkitektur
* vana att leda och stötta andra arkitekter och team i arkitekturella förändringar.


 Det är önskvärt att du har dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom komplexa it-organisationer, t ex myndighet eller annan stor organisation. Det är också önskvärt med flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet i agil utveckling och användning av modeller för att analysera och dokumentera arkitektur.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/186 | Kontakt: Jerker Moberg, Sektionschef jerker.moberg@skatteverket.se, Therese Schönbeck, HR-specialist therese.schonbeck@skatteverket.se, Yrsa Andersson, HR-specialist yrsa.andersson@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-04-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-02

title: IT Service Manager to NCC’s Digital Workplace team
description:
Do you want to make a real difference and make decisions that improve people's everyday lives? At NCC, we can offer you just that! You’ll get the opportunity to work in an environment influenced by sustainability, digitalization, and innovation.
   

  

 The construction industry is currently facing a development leap where the change agent is spelled digitalization. NCC is leading the way by developing our business and future proofing our IT platform. We are currently recruiting IT professionals who thrive on becoming important players in our digital transformation journey, taking construction to new heights through IT.
   

  

 As IT Service Manageryou will have overall responsibility for the end-user facing delivery of M365 application services within our Digital Workplace area. Digital Workplace (DWP) services at NCC include digital services (communication, collaboration, information and workflows) as well as the applications through which these services are delivered. As a Service Manager for M365 applications you are proactively designing, governing and developing our application services on M365. You engage with relevant vendors and suppliers to secure service delivery. You work closely with the key business stakeholders to understand their business demands and requirements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Governance and securityof M365 application services on the M365 platform.
* Ensure that governance processes are designed, defined and configurations are set up accordingly.
* Make sure service and end userdocumentation is in place and up to date.
* Develop the service to achieve SLA, KPI and CSAT targets.
* Maintenance, process support and budgeting to ensure service and IT security compliance.
* Conduct life-cycle management activities and follow-up to ensure that the environment is constantly optimized.
* Maintain the Evergreen M365environment, supporting and advising on how to utilize the features in the best way at NCC.
* Digitize and automate current IT and Business activities to maximize business value.
* Identify and explore opportunities for service and business improvements incl. more efficient use of the available technologies and automation capabilities.
* Collaborate with other IT teams, ServiceDesk, support partners and business units according to defined service governance structures.
* Maintain and develop vendor relationships.


**About Finance & IT**
 You will join the Group function “Finance & IT”, which leads NCC´s strategic development and major change programs in the business. Finance & IT is NCC’s development and delivery function for IT as well as operations development and research & innovation. We are a Nordic organization working together closely under one common management. Cooperation in- and between units is key for us to deliver value to NCCs business areas, and therefore we have adapted an Agile team-based setup with a focus on collaboration, people and efficient delivery and development.
   

  

**Your Experience And Background**
* You are well experienced in developing, designing, and managing the complete lifecycle - planning, control and managing of M365 services. You are used to working with connecting business, IT and vendors and the relationships between processes and systems.
* Experience in working with ITSM processes as the day-to-day operations include managing changes, requests, and problems.
* Professional experience in managing M365 and an extensive understanding of how M365 is connected to IT- infrastructure, identity and security.
* You have a degree in Computer Science or other relevant field
* Excellent ability in English language (oral and written), as well as fluency in one of the Nordic languages.
* You are skilled in stakeholder management and can understand requirements and turn them into delivered services.


 To be successful in the position we see thar you easily communicate and engage with others. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as well as a result-oriented mindset. You are eager to develop with high ambitions in leveraging the potential of the entire M365 platform and how the different applications and services work together in the best way. To achieve this, you also need to be structured and have great capacity to set capture, plan, structure, communicate and execute an idea from start to finish with agile methods. Collaboration with various stakeholders is crucial, and the ideal candidate is a high-performing team player with strong self-awareness and personal effectiveness skills.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This position is located at an NCC office in any of our major cities in Sweden, Denmark, Finland or Norway. The position requires some travelling, although we do apply a flexible way of working and strive to collaborate digitally as much as possible.
   

  

 In accordance with NCCs safety culture we conduct background checks on final candidates. You will be reporting to the IT Competence Manager whilst working cross-functions in an Agile team.
   

  

**Contact and application**
 Please register your application with cover letter and CV in English. Selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible but no later than May 30, 2025. For further information on this position, please contact Anders Blankholm, IT Competence Manager, +45 60915391.
   

  

**NCC Offers**
 NCC strives to be an appealing employer, with a work environment where employees grow and experience well-being. Therefore, we offer a wide range of employee benefits NCC has collective agreements for all employees, providing a solid foundation of security and clear guidelines so that you know what applies to your employment. We also offer excellent opportunities for continued development and a broad range of further education options, allowing for a long career within the company.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!**
 At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers.
   

  

 With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.
   

  

**NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics.**

title: Associate Director of Engineering
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **420 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability.
* Listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.



  





**We at The Search team** 
 are responsible for some of the most vital and impactful features of the Truecaller application. These include:
 


* Caller Identification: Identifying who is calling and making sure users can take educated decisions to pick up or not
* Spam Protection: Identifying and blocking spam numbers, calculating spam likelihood, and enhancing overall spam detection.
* Name Accuracy: Guaranteeing that users see the most accurate and reliable names associated with numbers.
* Fraud Protection: Developing and maintaining services to protect users from fraudulent calls and scams.



  





**As the Associate Director of Engineering for the Search team** 
 , you will lead cross-functional disciplines including Android, Backend, QA, and Data. You’ll provide strategic technical leadership and oversee the day-to-day management of the engineering team, while also partnering closely with the VP of Engineering to drive organization-wide engineering initiatives.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




* Manage and lead Android, Backend, QA, and data disciplines within the Search team.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to the engineering team.
* Mentor and develop team members.
* Participate in strategic planning and decision-making for the engineering team (including conducting technical design reviews)
* Drive continuous improvement in processes and technologies.
* Collaborate closely with the business unit lead to align engineering initiatives with overall business objectives and strategies. This involves:
* Regular meetings to discuss progress, challenges, and upcoming priorities
* Jointly defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success
* Ensuring that engineering solutions meet the specific needs of the business unit
* Proactively identifying and addressing potential risks and dependencies
* Fostering a strong working relationship based on open communication and trust
* Collaborate closely with the VP of Engineering to identify and drive horizontal engineering initiatives that span multiple teams or departments. This may include:
* Establishing and promoting standard engineering practices and processes.
* Leading cross-functional projects to solve complex technical challenges.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities to leverage shared technologies and resources.
* Fostering a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing across engineering teams.
* Ensure high-quality software delivery and adherence to best practices.



  





**What you bring in:** 



* Proven leadership experience in managing and mentoring engineering teams, preferably in mobile app development.
* Strong technical background in backend systems (JVM-based or similar).
* Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and ability to drive efficient development workflows.
* Solid understanding of mobile CI/CD pipelines and release management.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions (Product, Design, DevOps).Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality software in a fast-paced environment.



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Knowledge of performance optimization for Android applications.
* Experience with security best practices.
* Prior experience in hiring and scaling mobile engineering teams.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Manager of Digital Transformation & IT Product Management
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 The Manager of Digital Transformation & IT Product Management is a visionary leadership role responsible for personally spearheading Dynavox Group's digital transformation efforts while managing internal IT product portfolios. This role goes beyond traditional management to directly identify, conceptualize, and champion innovative digital opportunities across the organization. While overseeing IT Product Managers and Digitalization Managers, this leader will actively drive the discovery and execution of transformative digital solutions, streamline operations, and revolutionize business processes through technology. The ideal candidate will be both a hands-on innovator and a strategic leader who proactively shapes the company's digital future.
   

  

 In this role you would report to the Head of Information Technology and be part of the IT management team. The role is based in Stockholm but important stakeholders, as well as some team members, are based in Pittsburgh. Some travel, although not extensive, can be expected.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Identify, conceptualize, and champion digital transformation opportunities throughout the organization. Proactively seek out areas for automation, process optimization, and digital innovation that support business goals.
* Actively scout emerging technologies and market trends to develop visionary digital strategies that provide competitive advantages. Challenge the status quo and drive forward-thinking approaches to business challenges.
* Engage directly in solution design workshops, proof-of-concept development, and innovation sprints to drive breakthrough digital solutions.
* Manage and mentor a diverse team while fostering a culture of experimentation and innovation. Lead by example as an active participant in ideation and solution development.
* Build stakeholder and executive-level relationships to identify untapped opportunities for digital innovation. Act as the bridge between business needs and technological possibilities.
* Shape and champion a comprehensive digital transformation roadmap and product portfolio strategy, ensuring the timely delivery of solutions that improve efficiency, scalability, and business performance.


**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Digital Innovation, or a related field (Master's preferred).
* 10+ years of experience in IT product management, digital transformation, or related fields, with 5+ years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of personally identifying and successfully implementing large-scale digital transformation initiatives in a complex enterprise environment.
* Strong leadership skills with experience managing cross-functional teams.
* Hands-on understanding of modern technology stacks, digital platforms, cloud solutions, and enterprise software.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and drive change across all levels of the organization.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience personally leading digital transformation across multiple business domains (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations, Customer Service).
* Experience designing and building innovative solutions in Salesforce is a plus.
* Demonstrated innovation portfolio with examples of personally conceived and implemented digital solutions.


- 

**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Information Security Consultant
description:
*Hos oss på B3* 
 Secure får du möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad genom att hjälpa företag och myndigheter att stärka sin informationssäkerhet. Vi växer och letar nu efter fler härliga kollegor som vill vara med på resan!
   

  

 Vi tror på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där samarbete, kunskapsdelning och energi frodas. Vi är stolta över att ha erfarna och engagerade kollegor, en flexibel och modern arbetskultur samt en attraktiv ersättningsmodell. Här får du chansen att både bidra med din kompetens och utvecklas vidare – tillsammans med oss!
   

  

**Hur du kommer att bidra**
 Som informationssäkerhetskonsult hos oss får du arbeta i strategiska och rådgivande roller, där du hjälper verksamheter att införa och förbättra säkerhetslösningar. Dina arbetsuppgifter kan bland annat inkludera:
   

  

* Etablering av systematiskt och riskbaserat informationssäkerhetsarbete
* Utformning och införande av ISMS (Information Security Management System)
* Genomförande av GAP- och riskanalyser samt informationsklassningar
* Framtagning av policyer, riktlinjer och strategier för säkerhetsåtgärder
* Stöd till verksamhetsledning och IT-ansvariga i säkerhetsbeslut


 Vi tror att du trivs i en prestigelös och samarbetsinriktad miljö och har en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende hos kunder och kollegor.
   

  

**Är vi en bra match?**
 Vi letar efter dig som:
   

  

* Har minst tre års erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet eller närliggande områden
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet
* Gillar att samarbeta och dela med dig av din kunskap
* Har erfarenhet som konsult (meriterande, men inget krav)


**Vad du får hos oss**
 En arbetsplats där vi värdesätter frihet, gemenskap och balans
   

  

* En trygg anställning med schyssta villkor, konkurrenskraftig lön och fina förmåner
* En härlig wellness-satsning där vi tränar, peppar och inspirerar varandra
* Möjlighet att utbilda dig och certifiera dig inom det du brinner för
* Ett team där vi hjälper varandra att bli bättre – och har kul längs vägen!


**En arbetsplats som gör skillnad:**
 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.*
*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i* 
 Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.
   

  

**Nyfiken?**
 Vi hoppas det! Hör av dig så pratar vi mer – vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig. 💙

title: OT Cyber Security Consultant
description:
**About Us** 




 Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.
 



  





 What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.
 



  





**Job Role / Responsibilities** 



* Assisting our clients in securing their information systems (defining target objectives, developing action plans, implementing actions (organizational or technical), coordination, monitoring and managing these plans)
* Assessing our clients' cybersecurity posture against current norms and regulations (ISO 27001, NIS 2, IEC 62443, Cyber Resilience Act...) and through cybersecurity risk analysis (ISO 27005 / EBIOS RM)
* Integrating cybersecurity into our clients' projects
* Supporting our clients' CISOs in their daily activities: defining cybersecurity processes, drafting policies and documentation, conducting awareness sessions, organizing cyber crisis exercises, animating the client's cyber community
* Leading or deploying cybersecurity solutions specific to industrial environments.
* We work under fixed-price projects and/or in Time and Material mode. The duration of assignments depends on client needs, topics, and consultant aspirations – ranging from a few days to several months.
* Our clients vary widely: large enterprises and SMEs, across private and public sectors – industry, energy, luxury, maritime, transportation, institutions... in France and Worldwide.



  





**Hard Skills Required:** 



* You understand basic security concepts (CIA triad, vulnerability, risk, threat…)
* You have a technical mindset and understand core security components, their principles: systems and networks, security devices (firewalls, AV/EDR, VPN...), cloud (AWS, Azure, Google…)
* Familiarity with industrial/OT environments (SCADA, ICS…) is a plus – it's our specialty (and if not, we’ll train you!)
* You master risk analysis methodologies (ISO 27005, EBIOS RM). Even better if you’re certified!
* You're curious and have already read cybersecurity frameworks and methodologies (ISO27001/2, IEC 62443, ANSSI, NIS, NIST…)



  





**Soft Skills Required:** 



* Mindset is key: you’re motivated, dynamic, and autonomous
* You enjoy teamwork and value mutual support and customer service
* You know how to organize your activities, multitask, prioritize, and raise alerts when needed
* You have good writing skills, good spelling, and you're comfortable with Microsoft Office
* You speak and write fluent French and English (you can understand conversations, lead meetings, and write reports…)



  





**Other Requirements:** 



* Master’s degree or equivalent
* Certifications such as IEC 62443, ISO27001/2/5, EBIOS EM, ISC2 are a plus!
* Driver's license (B), useful for some travel



  





**Integrity360 Employee Benefits (Sweden)** 



* At Integrity360 we aim to reflect what’s important through the benefits we offer. We survey our people regularly and encourage discussions around these tops so we can understand what really makes a difference. Our benefits priorities are physical, mental and financial wellbeing.



  





**Mental & Physical wellbeing benefits:** 



* Private healthcare
* Health insurance
* Onsite Gym (Kista office)
* SEK 5,000.00/year for Friskvårdbidrag, our allowance can be used for Gym memberships, to improve health and more!



  





**Financial wellbeing:** 




 We guarantee that every employee will have their pay reviewed at least once every year, if not more regularly. We aim to pay within the market range for all roles and keep pace with inflation on average.
 



  





  





**Other benefits include:** 



* 30 days’ annual leave and options to carry over 5 days to the next financial year
* Our L&D program, we work with various platforms including Cybrary, Udemy, Preply, Pluralsight, Swift and HTB ensuring our people are up to date with their industry knowledge. Offering opportunities to further upskill and gain industry leading certifications.

title: First line support - Clas Fixare
description:
***Clas Fixare bygger framtidens hantverksbolag!***
 Clas Fixare brinner för att förenkla vardagen i varje hem genom att erbjuda små och stora hantverkstjänster till privat-och företagskunder över Sverige. Vi är ett 100% helägt dotterbolag till Clas Ohlson med en tydlig vision: att skapa ett schysst och modernt hantverksbolag med engagerade kollegor och nöjda kunder.
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av ett härligt team som hjälper människor i deras vardag? Vårt kundserviceteam är kompetent och serviceinriktat; vi har några av branschens nöjdaste kunder! Till Clas Fixare letar vi nu efter en serviceinriktad och proaktiv kundsupportmedarbetare.**
**Vad ska du göra?**
 Du kommer varje dag att ge Clas Fixares kunder och hantverkare förstklassig service vad det gäller bokning av fixartjänster via telefon och mejl. En del av tjänsten handlar om att säkra upp merförsäljning, både i kundbokningssamtal men också med utåtriktade aktiviteter till potentiella kunder. Du spelar även en central som support för Clas Fixares alla avdelningar och säkrar upp den dagliga driften.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
* Ett roligt och varierande arbete för ett unikt hantverksbolag
* Schysst arbetsmiljö där du kan vara dig själv och utvecklas i din riktning
* Platt organisation där medarbetare och kund är i fokus
* Fartfyllda och professionella kollegor
* After Work och andra sociala aktiviteter
* Hygienfaktor (som vi ser det) såsom generöst friskvårdsbidrag, företagshälsovård, kollektivavtal, marknadsmässig lön samt löneutfyllnad vid föräldraledighet. Dessutom har vi personalrabatt på Clas Ohlson med 20%


 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid oftast på plats på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm och/eller i Solna. Tjänsten kan komma att innefatta arbete på helger.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har ett naturligt inre driv och gillar att sätta upp egna målsättningar för hur mycket du hinner få gjort under en arbetsdag. Du är bra på att ”ta folk” och trivs utmärkt med att hjälpa andra, både kollegor och kunder. Du är lyhörd för kundens behov, vågar fråga kunderna efter ytterligare information när det behövs och förklara vilka förutsättningar som måste finnas för att tjänsten ska kunna genomföras på ett bra sätt. Att ta initiativ är inte främmande för dig och du kommer med förslag på lösningar när det behövs, men har heller inga problem med att följa regler och rutiner. Du känner dig trygg med att ha många bollar i luften och är bra på att hantera en fartfylld vardag.
   

  

 Du vill jobba självständigt och lägger stor vikt vid att uppträda korrekt, vara noggrann och samtidigt ge extra god service. För dig är det också viktigt att komma i tid och vara effektiv och du planerar och strukturerar ditt arbete för att kunna arbeta systematiskt och inte bli distraherad av saker som händer runt omkring.
   

  

 Du är trygg i dig själv och kan sätta gränser när det behövs.
   

  

**Det är viktigt att du känner igen dig i följande:**
* Du har gymnasieutbildning eller motsvarande
* Du är effektiv och strukturerad som person och får mycket gjort
* Du har erfarenhet av och trivs med att jobba med försäljning
* Du har minst tre års kundrelaterad arbetslivserfarenhet med goda vitsord
* Du trivs i en föränderlig arbetsmiljö där riktlinjer kan ändras snabbt och man måste hantera mycket inkommande information
* Du har god IT-vana
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Meriterande om du har tidigare arbetat med eller kring bygg/snickeri/hantverk


 Känner du igen dig? Skicka in dig ansökan här nedanför. Vi vill gärna hitta vår nya medarbetare så fort som möjligt så vi intervjuar löpande. Hör mer än gärna av dig om du har frågor till pierre.dahlgren@clasfixare.se
   

  

**Vi tar dock inte emot ansökningar via mail.** 
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, vi vill gärna hitta våran nya kollega så fort som möjligt och intervjuer sker löpande. På Clas Fixare tillämpar vi alltid en provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

*Genom att ansöka samtycker jag till att Clas Fixare AB får nyttja mina personuppgifter i syfte att genomföra rekryteringsarbetet kopplat till detta rekryteringsärende i enlighet med Dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR). Personuppgifter sparas i upp till 24 månader.*
**Med din hjälp kan vi hjälpa folk till en enklare vardag!**
 Clas Ohlson grundades 1918 som en postorderfirma i Insjön, Dalarna. Idag är vi ett detaljhandelsbolag med kunder i Sverige, Norge och Finland.
   

  

 Mycket har hänt sedan starten, men en sak har varit densamma genom alla år: att vi vill hjälpa människor att fixa sina hem med praktiska och hållbara lösningar till attraktiva priser.

title: Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software
description:
Are you ready to build and lead a team that shapes the future of infrastructure solutions? Join Dustin as the Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software** 
**unique**
* Strategic Impact – Play a key role in structuring and scaling infrastructure solutions across all Dustin markets
* Growth Opportunity – Drive the future of Dustin’s infrastructure portfolio by shaping and expanding a high-potential business, combining hardware, software, and services into a strong commercial offering
* Collaborative Culture – Work for an international company where one of the core values is Win As A Team! This belief runs through our entire organization


 As Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software, you’ll be key in unlocking Dustin’s infrastructure potential by developing a focused portfolio of products and software licenses. With a significant growth opportunity, you’ll collaborate with sales teams and stakeholders to build a high-growth business across all markets, shaping the future from the ground up.
   

  

**My name is Åsa And Deschaume, and I am the VP for Infrastructure Solutions** 
**within Offering and Procurement.** 
 As a leader, I believe in empowerment and trust, giving my teams the freedom and support they need to thrive. I value open dialogue, honest conversations, and mutual respect. I enjoy working with people who are open-minded and willing to take on challenges. While I expect a lot from my team, it’s because I hold myself to the same high standards. At the same time, I bring energy and positivity to my work, creating an environment where people feel motivated to grow and succeed.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software**
***Responsibility* 
 :** 
 You will be given responsibility for driving and structuring Dustin’s Infrastructure Hardware and Software portfolio, balancing standalone product and license sales with strategic offerings that empower sales teams and strengthen key brand partnerships.
 ***Collaboration* 
 :** 
 Together with your team, which is currently under construction, you take care of developing and optimising the hardware and software offering to drive growth and customer value. While the team is small, your mission is ambitious, and you'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Solution Architects and Sales to ensure a strong, strategic, and market-driven portfolio.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead and develop a small, strategic, and operational team: mentor and guide a focused team, ensuring they understand and deliver on the teammission
* Secure an attractive infrastructure portfolio: Take ownership of the infrastructure assortment, ensuring it meets market needs and drives profitable growth across all segments
* Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments: Work closely with Solution Architects, Sales, Procurement, and Marketing to align infrastructure offerings and ensure seamless execution


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives on building and leading teams, driving business growth, and shaping strategic infrastructure offerings across multiple markets.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* Experience with Offering Management, Product Management within a Vendor, Distributor, Reseller, or Operator
* Strong leadership skills, cross-cultural experience, and the ability to drive teams across countries
* Solid knowledge of the infrastructure area
* A customer-focused and self-driven mindset
* Experience with go-to-market strategies and strategic planning
* Fluency in English (our company language) and one Scandinavian language, with strong communication and presentation skills


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening TA partner Elza van Grootel-Coenraats
* 1st interview with a senior member of the management team
* Personality assessment through Assessio
* Case interview with hiring manager Åsa And Deschaume
* 3th interview - Phone call with Michael Haagen - EVP Offering & Procurement
* Reference check


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel-Coenraats via e-mail.

title: Cyber Security Consultant
description:
Tillsammans med 14 andra nordeuropeiska IT-företag har vi bildat itm8, ett nytt powerhouse inom digital transformation. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med på resan och som trivs i situationer där alla svar inte redan är givna, men du kommer att ta dig an att finna dem tillsammans med ambitiösa och drivna kollegor.
   





 Den här rollen är avgörande för att stötta företagets tillväxt och säkerställa att vi levererar högkvalitativa resultat inom cybersäkerhet. Just nu befinner sig bolaget i en fas av expansion, där vi möter både ökade kundkrav och ett ökat behov av tjänster inom cybersäkerhet.
 



 Teamet står inför spännande utmaningar som kräver specialiserad kompetens för att ta fram säkra lösningar, hantera komplexa projekt, driva innovation, och det är här denna roll blir central. 
 



****Detta stämmer sannolikt in på vår nästa m8****



* Djupgående kunskap inom Microsoft Security-verktyg ( Defender, Intune, EASM, Security Exposure Management, Entra ID, Conditional Access, Purview)
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera säkerhetslösningar i Microsoft-miljöer med fokus på Zero Trust
* Förståelse för säkerhetsstandarder och ramverk (t.ex. NIS2, ISO 27001)
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom cybersäkerhet, gärna i konsultrollen
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Meriterande: Certifieringar som SC-200, SC-300, AZ-500, SC-100 eller liknande
* Problemlösare med ett analytiskt sinne
* Stark samarbetsförmåga och förmåga att bygga förtroende med kunder
* Drivkraft att ständigt hålla sig uppdaterad inom cybersäkerhetsområdet
* Goda kunskaper inom svenska och engelska



**Creating the Difference – today, tomorrow, together** 




 Tillsammans säkerställer vi de bästa tjänsterna för att bli Nordens ledande digitala transformationspartner inom Cloud & Infrastructure, Digital Transformation, Cybersecurity och Application Services. itm8 finns representerat på 26 platser i Danmark, Sverige, Filippinerna samt Tjeckien.
 



 Hos oss finns inga stora egon eller magiker. Vår superkraft är att lyssna noga, lösa kundernas 1000-bitars pussel och kavla upp ärmarna för ett seriöst dedikerat arbete. Vi ifrågasätter det förväntade och utvecklar lösningar som tar våra kunder, och oss själva, flera steg längre.
 



 Läs gärna mer om vår story, kultur och våra erbjudanden www.itm8.se.  Du är också varmt välkommen att lära känna oss mer på Instagram @itm8inside.
   





**Redo att utmana(s) med itm8?**




 Varmt välkommen att ansöka till tjänsten nedan. Om du inte är redo att ansöka än och har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt.

title: Konsulter till B3 HealthTech
description:
**Vill du vara med?**
 Vi vill att alla som jobbar hos oss ska trivas och vakna upp med ett leende på måndag morgon. Vi kanske inte är Sveriges bästa bolag inom allt, men vi vann priset som Årets Karriärföretag 2022 och vi kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt Great Place to Work 2021. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De pratar också om vår energifyllda kultur som består av lärande, wellness och öppenhet. Stoltheten över hur vi hjälper våra kunder men även hur vi tar ansvar i vårt samhälle genom våra samarbeten med Suicide Zero, Women in tech, Pink Programming, Convictus och Changers Hub.
   

  

**B3 HealthTech** 
**arbetar med digitalisering av vården. Vi** 
**förbättrar och effektiviserar svensk** 
**hälso- och sjukvård.**
 Vi levererar både specialistkonsulter och team/projekt/åtaganden. Den röda tråden är gedigen kunskap om den teknik och informationshantering som digitalisering inom vården kräver.
   

  

 B3 HealthTech gör avtryck och skapar samhällsnytta, något som engagerar och motiverar oss alla.
   

  

 Vi vill bli fler och söker i dagsläget blivande kollegor inom ett flertal roller.
   

  

 Gemensamt för dessa roller är senioritet, domänkunskap inom hälso- och sjukvården, driv, energi och hjärta. Vill du vara med och förstärka vårt erbjudande till Sveriges vårdaktörer? Vill du ha spännande och intressanta uppdrag hos B3:s kunder inom både den privata och den offentliga sektorn?
   

  

**Rollerna vi söker är:**
* Informationsarkitekter (Hälsoinformatiker)
* Integrationsexperter
* Arkitekter (System/teknik, verksamhet och lösning)
* Applikationsspecialister Cambio Cosmic
* Kravanalytiker


 Vill du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba på B3 och hur vi arbetar med vår wellness och våra sociala initiativ, klicka här.
   

  

 Klicka på ansökan eller tveka inte att kontakta:
   

  

 Christina Löfgren christina.lofgren@b3.se 079-3356532

title: Business Information Modeler with knowledge of Information architecture to SEB Kort Stockholm
description:
Do you have a passion for information modelling and wants to be a part of SEB Korts digital transformation journey? Apply today!
   

  

 SEB Kort is on a journey transforming our business based on new competition, shifting customer demands as well as new laws and regulations. Do you have a passion for technology, payments, and digital transformation, and would like to work cross Nordic? Do you want to contribute to making SEB Kort more data driven? We are now looking for a business information modeler to support and accelerate our Information journey within SEB Kort.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our data and information is in the center and core of our business. Keeping a well structured Business Information Model is vital to deliver with high quality in business- as well as regulatory initiatives.
   

  

 You will be part of the Data management team, with responsibility for further developing SEB Kort’s Business Information Model. You will be working in a small agile team with one colleague with the same role as you, who has been working in this role for many years. We began our journey with our Business Information Model more than a decade ago, and it is still expanding, which is why we need your help.
   

  

 You will be involved in initiatives and business development where information is constantly changed, added or created. The work is done in close collaboration with all parts of SEB Kort’s organization units. We work closely together within our team, but have individual tasks in order to complete our deliveries.
   

  

**Your Daily Work Will Consist Of**
* Actively develop, document and maintain SEB Kort Business Information Model and Business Rules.
* Understand and interpret SEB Kort Enterprise Information strategies.
* Assist with information requirements related to SEB Kort Business Information Model for SEB Kort’s data warehouse.
* Guide and support business stakeholders, solution architects and database modelers/developers concerning SEB Kort Business Information Model.
* Promote Information and Data Management within the organization.
* Create and maintain training material regarding SEB Kort Business Information Model and Business Rules, as well as conduct trainings & workshops.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 As a person we think you are methodic and organized. You have an holistic view as well as a keen eye for details. You have an ability to understand business challenges and translating them into information requirements. You use a delivery oriented approach with a broad understanding of the positive effects of having sound management of information and the business opportunities it gives. An open mindset and good communication skills are essential to succeed in this role.
   

  

**We Think You Have/are**
* Interest in and experience of information modelling.
* Interest in and knowledge of both information, technology and business architecture.
* Fluent in English, oral and written.


**Meriting Is**
* A university degree within Computer Science or Business Architect.
* Experience as an architect or comparable role within the information area.
* Knowledgeable in data warehouse techniques.
* Experience from the banking sector or the payment industry.
* Experience of workshop facilitation.


 What we offer
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Empowering Nordic environment.
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Long-term stability.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself. Since we select candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than May 11th 2025.
   

  

 For further information and questions, please contact Caroline Thörne, Head of Data Management at SEB Kort via carolina.thorne@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner Sebastian Vesterlund, sebastian.vesterlund@seb.se
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Are you a recent graduate or early in your career and excited to grow in a global tech environment? Join our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Competence Centre at ASSA ABLOY and take the first step in building a meaningful and international career!
   

  

 We’re looking for a junior professional who is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, this full-time, permanent role offers the opportunity to work with stakeholders across the globe, supporting the development of tools and processes that drive innovation and collaboration across our manufacturing and R&D sites. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.
   

  

**What You Will Do As Our Junior Business Analyst**
 As our Junior Business Analyst, you will play a key support role, driving engagement with end-users and helping document and refine ways of working across our organization. You will engage with users worldwide (on-site and online) to uncover pain points and improvement opportunities. You will also document current (As-Is) and future (To-Be) processes using intuitive mapping techniques such as Sticky Notes and SIPOC.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Support Product Owners by ensuring User Stories are clear, aligned with product strategy, and meet our Definition of Done
* Validate completed stories, including verifying acceptance criteria and persistent tests
* Execute our training strategy: maintain the training calendar, administer training logistics, and communicate updates internally
* Ensure training materials are user-focused and easy to understand—not overly technical
* Contribute to long-term process improvement by piloting Process Mining methods with stakeholders


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A completed Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Product Lifecycle Management, CAD, or Production Engineering.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A self-driven, results-oriented attitude with the ability to adapt easily to change.
* Excellent listening skills and the curiosity to dig deeper to fully understand user needs.
* A growth mindset and eagerness to keep learning.


 It’s a plus if you also have experience working with PLM IT systems and possibly a background as a trainer or educator. Familiarity with organizational change management, working across cultures and time zones, and knowledge of SAFe’s Design Thinking principles and Gemba Walks are all considered strong advantages.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary
* Hybrid model of working
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Engineering Manager - Data & Analytics Engineering
description:
Are you ready to lead the way in data innovation at NOBA Bank Group? We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Engineering Manager to join our Data & Analytics Engineering team!
   

  

***Data & Analytics Engineering** 
 is currently defining global subgroups focused on backend, frontend, and data management. As the Engineering Manager, you will lead a cross-country team, in Norway and Stockholm, and play a crucial role in advancing our data technology and personnel. Your responsibilities include guiding data initiatives, overseeing data solution development, and collaborating across various parts of the bank. This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth, including global leadership development and engagement in exciting projects like the Common Data Platform, global data modeling, and new business reporting.*
**With Us You Can Expect**
 ✨ A flat organization with fast decision-making processes
   

  

 ✨ Development opportunities within your role and within the organization
   

  

 ✨ Freedom with responsibility
   

  

 ✨ Fun activities together with your team and the office
   

  

 ✨ A culture where feedback, coaching leadership and community are important
   

  

 NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!
   

  

**Specific Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Lead one of the teams within Data & Analytics Engineering
* Oversee data-related solutions and projects within the Analytics Engineering area.
* Provide technical guidance and oversight for data solutions.
* Assume partial product ownership or technical lead responsibilities.
* Develop and maintain Power BI reports, datasets, consumer-specific models, and data marts.
* Drive the creation and maintenance of a common data platform for future global use.
* Manage stakeholder relationships and drive change within the team.
* Recruit and develop talent within the team.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
* Holds a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field.
* Has a minimum of 5 years of work experience in data engineering or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
* Possesses strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of data professionals.
* Has in-depth knowledge of data engineering and analytics principles, tools, and technologies, including data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and data visualization.
* Is proficient in Microsoft on-premise and cloud data solutions, including MS SQL, SSIS, PBI, Azure Data Bricks, DBT, and Python.


**It Is Advantageous If You**
* Have project and product management skills, including experience with data-related project planning and execution.
* Is fluent in one of the Nordic languages


**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 To thrive in this role, you need to be a strong leader capable of driving change and managing a high-paced environment. You should excel in stakeholder management and cross-country team leadership, with a passion for innovative projects and modernization efforts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as is the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You must be goal-oriented, focused on delivering high-quality data solutions within set timelines and budgets, collaborative with cross-functional teams, and possess strong problem-solving skills. A humble and team-focused approach is also important for success!
   

  

**In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Practical Information**
**Start:** 
 By agreement
   

  

**Location** 
 : Oslo or Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Full-time
   

  

**Working hours:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

 We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.*

title: Technical Writer
description:
Welcome experienced educator or technical writer with strong IT business analysis or digital education skills. In this role, you will improve how embedded systems and software are taught and documented within Product Data Management (PDM) systems. The goal is to create clear, structured training materials and sessions for engineers working in a dynamic, global environment.
   

  

 Ready to make waves? This could be your perfect catch! 🌊
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop educational materials such as workflows, step-by-step guides, and technical documentation.
* Conduct both classroom-based theory lessons and hands-on training sessions.
* Translate complex technical topics into easy-to-understand content.
* Support continuous improvement in how we teach and document PDM processes.
* Help structure a consistent and pedagogical way of working across teams.


**Your** 
**profile**
 You enjoy making complex topics easy to understand. Whether your background is in technical writing, education, or business analysis, you bring a strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly and engagingly.
   

  

 You are confident working in a fast-paced, agile environment and have experience adapting content to meet the needs of a global audience. Your communication skills are excellent, and you understand how to structure information in a pedagogical and accessible way – whether for classroom training or digital formats. You're also comfortable collaborating across teams and adjusting to shifting priorities.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Master's degree in Science (or equivalent experience).
* Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Available to work on site at least 3 days per week (Wednesdays required), and up to 5 days if needed.


 This is a great opportunity to shape how technical knowledge is shared in a global engineering environment. If you're passionate about clear communication, smart education, and making the complex simple – we would love to hear from you! 🐟
   

  

**Start** 
 : ASAP
   

  

**Workload** 
 : 100%
   

  

**Duration** 
 : 2 years
   

  

**Location** 
 : Hybrid setup with on-site presence required at least 3 days per week.
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : right away or latest April 26
   

  

**Contact** 
 : veronica@fiskenivattnet.se
   

  

*Please note the last application date and know that we leave the jobpost on our web until the assignment is signed. Also kindly send your application in English.*
*Note that to the enormous preassure on popular roles we might take down the jobpost before than the last date is due.*
**About Fisken i Vattnet**
 Welcome to a thoughtful consultant agency with a variety of specialists for contemporary communication, marketing and generative AI. For us, it's about conveying meaningful contexts where both you and we feel like the "fish in the water".

title: Security Manager
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Construction
description:
**About the company** 




  





 Our client’s company operates in the data center industry, providing a range of services across the Nordics region, particularly in the construction and management of data centers. They specialize in delivering tailored solutions, including infrastructure development, engineering, and operational support, to meet the growing demands of the data center market in Northern Europe.
 



  





 We are looking for a full-time, experienced Security Manager for one of their group companies, which specializes in developing a new product—an innovative security system for data centers. This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Designing, implementing, and managing physical security programs for mission-critical environments.
* Oversee access control, surveillance (CCTV), perimeter security, intrusion detection, drons and other security measures.
* Conduct risk assessments, audits, and security gap analyses to identify vulnerabilities and implement mitigation plans.
* Ensure compliance with ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI-DSS, NIST, and other industry standards for physical security.
* Manage relationships with security vendors, integrators, and law enforcement agencies.
* Lead security investigations, incident response, and crisis management for physical security breaches.
* Collaborate with IT, operations, and facilities teams to integrate physical security plans.
* Oversee badge access systems, biometric authentication, and other identity management solutions.
* Maintain security documentation, including policies, procedures, and emergency response plans.



  





**Job requirements:** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in Security Management, Criminal Justice, or a related field
* Certifications such as CPP (Certified Protection Professional), PSP (Physical Security Professional), CISSP, or CISM are a plus
* 10+ years of experience in critical infrastructure or high-security environments, data centers in particular would be a big plus
* Strong knowledge of security technologies, biometric access controls, and perimeter defence strategies
* Similar professional experience in a security role, with a focus on physical security management
* Excellent organizational management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
* Demonstrated experience in overseeing physical security protocols, conducting risk assessments, and designing security policies
* HSE experience would be a plus
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly with all levels of the organization and direct management
* Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
* Fluent English (verbal and written) is required
* Certification from professional security associations (e.g. CPP, PSP, etc.) is a plus
* Continuing professional development: participation in conferences, seminars, and workshops focused on the latest developments in physical security and data center management
* Knowledge of security technologies and systems: training in the latest security technologies and systems, such as biometric access control, video surveillance, and intrusion detection systems and communications protocols.



  





**Offer:** 




  




* A competitive salary, pension plan
* A good remuneration package
* Opportunities for professional development within the fast-growing datacenter industry
* The opportunity to work with Europe’s largest datacenters construction, setting new industry benchmarks

title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
Vill du vara med och göra samhället möjligt på en av Sveriges största IT-avdelningar? Skatteverket erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor skapar samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Vi söker nu integrationsutvecklare med ansvar för att utveckla och testa integrationer både inom Skatteverket och mot andra myndigheter. I denna roll kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i arbetet med att säkerställa robusta och säkra integrationer.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som integrationsutvecklare med ansvar för tekniska tester arbetar du i ett agilt team med utveckling och förvaltning av integrationer. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med varierande uppgifter i en teknisk miljö som idag omfattar bland annat Oracle och Informatica Power Center, samt andra integrationstekniker.
   

  

 I samverkan med team som hanterar mål- och källsystem levererar du högkvalitativa integrationer. Du arbetar både självständigt och i team, där samarbete och prestigelöshet är centrala faktorer för framgång. Vi befinner oss i en pågående systemförnyelse där vi inför modern teknik och utvecklar vår arkitektur.
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor har du roligt på jobbet samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnytta. Du har frihet och eget ansvar att bidra till nya lösningar. Vi är en stor it-avdelning som erbjuder dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av integrationsutveckling
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av test
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet och kunskap av Linux och Oracle. Det är också önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av ETL-utveckling i Informatica Power Center eller liknande.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/262 | Kontakt: Tomas Stjernholm, sektionschef tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, Maria-Claudia Sun Han Cordova, hr-specialist maria-claudia.sun.han.cordova@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-04-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-04

title: Senior IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for Senior IT Architects to help our clients on national and international projects! (Senior) IT Architects are part of our consulting teams who focus for instance on tech-oriented analyses, review & specification of IT systems or architectures, technical solution design, process improvement and target architecture definitions. Together with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group, you will develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying your technical know-how combined with your analytical and conceptual skillset. Based on your IT project experience, you are able to provide content guidance to and coordinate smaller teams.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* completed a university degree in computer science, informatics, engineering, or a related discipline with higher-than-average grades
* bring a minimum of four years relevant experience in IT consulting, management of IT projects, or professional software development
* have led project teams of more than three people
* know that modern tools, such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords - but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* are familiar with popular software development methods and tools
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts - while traveling to our clients in- and outside of your home country
* are on a fluent level of understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* You will form the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating our clients' digital capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* You will manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be responsible for the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements, such as cyber resilience
