 In Sweden we are on a growth journey with a client portfolio which includes leaders in several different industries, including both national and multinational companies. Together with SAP, we collaborate on delivering major IT & business transformations for our clients in collaboration with CXO-level.
   

  

 Many of our clients are undergoing major strategic changes, e.g. establishing new business models or reviewing the resilience of their business or transforming to become truly customer-oriented. They also need to take steps in their digitalization journey to enable move to cloud, use innovations such as AI, be sustainable and compliant with the future we are already in. Our role is to guide the client to execute their strategic choices into action. This often involves assessing value of different options, establishing new operating models, recommending how to proceed with new technology or how to re-design a supply chain or an organization to fit the new needs.
   

  

 KPMG offers services in a diverse range of areas, equipping us with the skillsets needed to deliver on large, cross-functional SAP transformations. We are working with both top- and bottom-line improvements for our clients, with support of a broad range of domestic and international experts and frameworks – as well as the capability to be innovative.
   

  

 As a
 **SAP Finance** 
**Management Consultant** 
 in our team you will work in large programs all the way from pre study to implementation. You will advice the client and project team in SAP Finance related topics to ensure the clients get the maximum value from their SAP investment and support them on the road towards a modern Finance organization (based on Future of Finance), ensure the project team and client understands and get the benefits out of innovations in relations to SAP Finance, bridge the gap between Business and technology in our large SAP programs and ensure the program delivers high quality deliverables and advice connected to SAP Finance.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**We are looking for** 
 high performing and professionals who can combine classical management consulting with modern applications and technology. We believe you have some experience from SAP and are well aligned with the future of SAP. This includes transformations towards SAP S/4HANA, the cloud shift through private edition (RISE) and public edition (GROW) as well as innovations available by SAP.
   

  

* You may have experience from SAP Finance S/4HANA implementations,
* You may have experience from and interested in working with the largest Swedish global companies,
* You have understanding for the connection between the business value and accurate implementation and improvements in the SAP Finance area.
* You can understand and translate client’s needs into effective solutions.
* You are curious personality and have the ability to stay up to date with the latest and greatest within the SAP Finance area,
* You are collaborative personality and strive in seeing team members to succeed and develop our SAP practice,
* You have a relevant academic background (e.g., business and/or engineering)
* You are fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Our offer**
* An exciting opportunity to work with our clients in their SAP transformations towards S/4 HANA, cloud mindset and innovation.
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* Engaged colleagues collaborating cross functional, both locally but also internationally
* Where we learn from each other and accelerating your growth and development
* A flexible workplace
* Personal development, we believe in the individual's drive
* A global workplace with a network of superstars


**Want to make a difference with us?**
 Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis.
   

  

 For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Manager - Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se
   

  

**We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!**

title: Teamlead / Facilities Coordinator
description:
Stockholm - Stockholms lan - Sweden
   

  

 CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) produces comprehensive property management services and solutions for its customers. We specialize in managing integrated real estate services, technical maintenance of real estate, project and project management services.
   

  

 At CBRE Global Workplace Solutions we believe our working spaces should allow everyone to feel comfortable, productive and inspired in their working environment. Because when people feel inspired, great things happen. We are a workplace team providing Facility Services across EMEA for a prestigious global technology client. We are now looking for a unique, passionate, excited, vivacious person to join us in creating that sense of community, who will put the well-being of others at the forefront.
   

  

 In this role a s Team Lead / FC you will collaborate with colleagues to inspire customer moments of delight and pursue amazing outcomes each day. You will be an ambassador of a one team approach within Operations team, representing CBRE and Client brand.
   

  

 Supporting the day to day operations of Facilities Services, providing high quality customer service and experiences creating a fun and safe place to work including office administration, health & safety activities and ad hoc service requests.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be customer focused, highly motivated, proactive and show great initiative to keep the office running smoothly.
   

  

 Core Responsibilities
   

  

 Quality, Health, Safety and Environment
   

  

* It is the overall objective for all of our roles to participate in creating and enhancing our safety culture. To support this you’ll log quality hazards and ensure resulting actions are closed out. This helps make our spaces safer and improve the safety culture
* You build your knowledge of and abide by all CBRE & Client Health & Safety Policy and Procedures to ensure a healthy and safe working environment for staff, contractors, customers and clients
* You assist with Building Evacuation Team training and drills
* You will embed a culture of safe working and compliance capturing RISE Behaviors


 Operations
   

  

* Customer service is at the heart of what we do and you provide high class professional service at all times
* You are accountable for all facilities issues related to the site and ensure remedial actions are completed proactively
* You actively encourage a culture of proactive management of space and standards
* Demonstration of success is key to this role and you will strive to excel in the delivery of KPI's and SLA's for your site
* Together with your team you provide all mailroom, logistics, stationery, distribution, reception and event services as required
* Relationships are key to our success and you work hard to maintain constructive and positive professional relationships with clients, colleagues and supply partners


 Project and Programs
   

  

* You are accountable for the First Day of Business preparation and execution
* Actively look for innovation that will improve any aspect of the contract.
* You lead by example and Identify and suggest innovations that will drive account improvement, through the sharing of best practice ideas and encouragement of a continuous improvement culture


 People
   

  

* Team success is of high importance to you and as such you seek to constantly motivate performance and embed Performance Management cycle creating a culture of high motivation, recognition and engagement
* You understand team development and strength areas and ensure opportunities for growth and succession planning
* You provide consistent, constructive feedback (both positive and developmental) through regular one-on-one meetings and performance reviews
* Your role encompasses the management of all human resources-related processes pertaining to people management supported by the local HR


 Supplier Management
   

  

* You manage, coordinate and supervise supplier personnel and subcontractors to ensure satisfactory completion of service delivery
* You ensure Health & Safety procedures are followed by all including supplier Health & Safety inductions, RAMS review and approval, appropriate Permit To Works are in place and review of practices
* Ensure that all contracts are effectively managed and controlled to achieve Service Level Agreements and customer delight


 Finance
   

  

* You oversee operational budget and accruals within contract guidelines and financial procedures ensuring spend compliance
* You are responsible for your budget and you manage all costs to ensure it is respected and address any related queries, including invoicing/ PO’s that might arise
* You are continually looking for saving opportunities to reduce client costs


 Undertake all other duties & tasks as reasonably requested by your line manager
   

  

 Based on size, scale and location of your site you may be required to undertake aspects of other roles.
   

  

**Succeeding In This Role**
* Preferred higher educational qualifications (or equivalent)
* Fluency in written and spoken English & Swedish languages with strong communication skills
* Displays proactive day-to-day problem solving, with ownership and pride
* A basic understanding of good health & safety practices, engages in Health & Safety culture
* Experience in fostering high-performing teams
* Proven financial accuracy and expertise
* Ability to prioritize, whilst engaging in self development


**What Do We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Possibility to learn from leading global company producing real estate services
* Awesome colleagues and exciting working environment
* Welcoming you to CBRE’s Performance Management cycle


 Last date of application 15.5.2025
   

  

 For any inquiries about the role you may contact the Regional Facilities Manager: Tiina Luukkonen, tiina.luukkonen@cbre.com
   

  

 CBRE är världens största kommersiella fastighets- och investeringsföretag. På CBRE är vår passion att leverera marknadsledande fastighetsrelaterade tjänster som bidrar till våra kunders framgång! Våra ca 115 000 anställda hjälper investerare, fastighetsägare och hyresgäster via våra cirka 530 kontor över hela världen och omsatte år 2022 över 30,8 miljarder dollar. CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) är ett affärsområde inom CBRE som levererar integrerade tjänster inom fastighetsförvaltning, teknisk fastighetsdrift, projektledning, rådgivning samt energieffektivisering
   

  

**Service line:** 
 GWS Segment

title: Digital CRM Architect (Microsoft Dynamics 365 + AI)
description:
At Riverty, we believe that everyone should be in control of their own financial situation. Our shared commitment is to make financial solutions more innovative, empathetic and user-friendly to empower financial growth for everyone. To do this, we rely on 50 years of experience and the commitment of over 5,000 creative minds, innovators and explorers in 11 countries.
 



**Are you ready?** 




 As part of our community, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills and transform the world of finance together with us. We create an environment where you can evolve personally and benefit from our flexible working conditions and work-life balance.
 



**We are seeking a** 
 Digital CRM Architect (Microsoft Dynamics 365 + AI)
 **(m/f/d) to join our team at one of our locations in Münster, Berlin, Amsterdam or Heerenveen. Be part of our mission to build the next generation of fintech!** 
 Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.
 



**Your key responsibilities will be:** 



* Define and execute the long-term roadmap for Dynamics 365 Contact Center, leading AI-driven automation initiatives to enhance operational efficiency.
* Analyze licensing structures and operational costs, implementing cost-saving strategies and providing data-driven insights on cost reductions and automation ROI.
* Act as the primary liaison between Operations, Business Units, and IT to align Dynamics 365 with company objectives and drive business process transformation.
* Oversee the migration from legacy platforms to Dynamics 365 Contact Center, ensuring seamless integration with other enterprise systems.
* Stay ahead of Microsoft's product roadmap, manage relationships with Microsoft and external vendors, and support contract negotiations.
* Define and track key metrics, provide reports on system performance, and collaborate with IT and BI teams to monitor automation effectiveness.
* Lead change management initiatives, partner with training departments to develop training programs, and oversee onboarding strategies to ensure effective use of Dynamics 365 capabilities.



**What you bring on the journey:** 



* Proven experience in defining and maintaining a long-term vision for Dynamics 365 Contact Center, including bridging business, IT, and Microsoft partnerships.
* Demonstrated ability to optimize licensing, automation ROI, and operational expenditures.
* Experience leading platform adoption and automation awareness initiatives.
* Expertise in Copilot, Power Automate, chatbots, and virtual agents, with a track record of identifying and improving case management and contact center workflows.
* Proven ability to ensure seamless connections with back - end system, Confluence, and other enterprise tools
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience identifying bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and AI optimization opportunities, and staying ahead of industry trends



**Why Join Us?** 



* Scale AI-powered customer service automation.
* Work with the latest Microsoft AI tools, including Copilot, Power Automate, and Virtual Agents.
* Act as the strategic link between business and technology, influencing enterprise-wide automation.
* Drive efficiency and cost savings in customer service operations



 #EUR8
 



**Benefits:** 



* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Customer oriented Investor Services Client Manager
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you ready to take your career to the next level with Danske Bank's Investor Services Client Management team? We are seeking a Client Manager to support our corporate and institutional clients in Sweden, ensuring their post-trade activities are seamless and efficient. As part of a dedicated team spanning Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Lithuania, you will build bridges across the bank, fostering strong client relationships.*
**About Us**
 As a Client Manager in Investor Services, you will support Swedish customers, offering daily assistance to major Nordic corporate and institutional clients in their custody activities. We focus on our customers’ needs for post trade services, which consists of a range of Investor Services products:
   

  

* Custody (Global Custody & Depositary Services), Asset Services, Securities Settlement, Tax
* Back- & Middle Office Services
* OTC Clearing
* ETD Clearing
* FX Services
* Collateral Management


 The team spearheads optimisation and transformational projects within Investor Services and the bank's post-trade value chain. As a customer-facing role, Investor Services Client Management ensures comprehensive accountability for meeting customer service needs across all Investor Services products.
   

  

 The position can be in Stockholm, Helsinki or Vilnius. Regular travelling to Sweden will be expected.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will gain expertise in custody and post-trade products, along with a thorough understanding of market, vendor, and regulatory dynamics to effectively engage with the team, customers, and internal stakeholders.
   

  

 Working with stakeholders, you will drive initiatives and maintain focus to meet customer needs and timelines, acting on behalf of the client. You will manage your own portfolio of Swedish clients, serving as their primary Client Manager for daily support and post-trade queries.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Collaborate with internal stakeholders e.g. Investor Services Sales, Relationship Management, Implementation, Network Management, IT, Operational teams.
* Secure sustainable customer relations with a proactive and service-minded approach.
* Lead and facilitate customer meetings.
* Participate in pre-sales and ad-hoc client meetings.
* Train customers on our digital solutions, guiding them guide through our digital transformation.
* Onboard new customers and expand services to existing ones.
* Lead and engage in various projects.


**Your profile**
 To do well in this role, you have to be customer and task oriented, organised and eager to learn. You thrive working independently, but you are still a flexible and reliable team member. Navigating the complexities of working with large corporate and institutional clients is essential.
   

  

 Ideally, you have experience in customer-facing roles or with the post-trade value chain in a financial institution.
   

  

 As part of our team, it is vital that you contribute to a good team spirit with an open-minded approach and maintain high-quality deliveries.
   

  

 The position requires strong communication skills, both written and spoken, with fluency in Swedish and proficiency in English.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are looking for employees who seek to develop themselves and our organisation. A career at Danske Bank is an opportunity to develop, grow and contribute to a culture of high aspirations. We offer a career at a leading Nordic bank with flexibility and an attractive working environment.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you have any questions reach out to Natasha Rajovic, Head of Investor Services Client Management: nkuz@danskebank.dk
   

  

 Please note, that we are processing applications on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 5 th of May.
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Teknisk utredare inom datalagring till PTS
description:
Vill du bidra till ett tryggare digitalt samhälle? Hos oss får du arbeta i ett högaktuellt område där din tekniska kompetens är med och formar framtidens regelverk och granskningar för digital trygghet och brottsbekämpning.
   

  

**Vi jobbar med det alla tar för givet. Att kunna kommunicera. Hos oss får du se till att det fungerar nu och i framtiden. För alla.**
 Enheten för betrodda tjänster och datalagring arbetar för att upprätthålla säkerheten i betrodda tjänster. Enheten arbetar också med frågor som rör skyldigheter hos operatörer att anpassa sin verksamhet så att uppgifter som är nödvändiga för brottsbekämpning kan lämnas ut till brottsbekämpande myndigheter.
   

  

 Jag som kommer vara din chef heter Johanna Eklund. För mig är det viktigt att skapa förutsättningar för en arbetsplats där medarbetarna trivs, blir sedda och kan utvecklas. Jag värnar om prestigelösa samarbeten, teamkänsla och gemenskap för att vi tillsammans ska arbeta mot våra mål och känna motivation och arbetsglädje.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I din roll som teknisk utredare kommer du att jobba med frågor som gör skillnad. Din tekniska kompetens är viktig för att säkerställa och värna om att ny teknik, lagstiftning och säkerhet ger bästa effekt och bidrar till samhällsnyttan.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i gränslandet mellan teknik, juridik och cybersäkerhet för att stärka säkerheten i samhällets digitalisering. Tillsammans med kollegor, såsom jurister, ekonomer och ingenjörer, bidrar du med teknisk kompetens i allt från tillsyn och regelutveckling till utredningar och analyser. Arbetet omfattar framförallt frågor som rör datalagring/lawful interception (LI) men kan också innebära arbete inom betrodda tjänster. Båda dessa områden är högt prioriterade och under snabb utveckling, både nationellt och på EU-nivå.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna varierar och omfattar bland annat att granska företags efterlevnad av regler, bistå med tekniska analyser och underlag i olika typer av uppdrag samt delta i framtagandet av nya regelverk. Du kommer att kunna driva egna sakfrågor inom våra ansvarsområden och få möjlighet att bidra med teknisk analys vid utredningar och uppdrag. I arbetet ingår även att följa teknikutvecklingen och analysera dess påverkan på våra områden.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med andra myndigheter, organisationer och företag. Du kommer att representera enheten och PTS i olika externa sammanhang. Hos oss får du arbeta i en miljö där teknik och juridik möts, där frågorna är aktuella och förändras snabbt och där du har möjlighet att bidra till ett område som gör skillnad i samhället.
   

  

**Om teamet**
 Vi är idag 9 personer som arbetar med frågorna och eftersom våra områden växer och utvecklas i snabb takt behöver vi nu stärka upp vårt team med ännu en teknisk utredare. Enheten kännetecknas av ett öppet och prestigelöst samarbete. Du har i hög grad möjlighet att påverka dina arbetsuppgifter utifrån din bakgrund och intressen.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du har en god förmåga att samarbeta med andra och trivs i en miljö där olika kompetenser och perspektiv möts. Med ett öppet och prestigelöst förhållningssätt skapar du förtroende och bygger relationer, samtidigt som du kan bidra med konstruktiv återkoppling och stöd när det behövs. När förutsättningarna förändras har du lätt för att tänka nytt och driva arbetet framåt utifrån det som gäller. Du behåller fokus och tar dig an dina arbetsuppgifter med både omdöme och ansvar. Du arbetar strukturerat, kan prioritera mellan olika uppgifter och arbeta utifrån en helhetssyn. I pressade situationer behåller du lugnet och bidrar till en stabil arbetsmiljö, både för dig själv och för andra. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga, därför kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dessa.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Utbildning på universitetsnivå inom data/it, systemvetenskap, it-/informationssäkerhet eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer vara relevant
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av kvalificerat arbete inom elektronisk kommunikation, exempelvis telekom/bredband/IP-telefoni/CPaaS eller relaterat område som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska


 Det är även meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av implementation och drift av LI-lösningar/arbete från tillverkare, mobiloperatör eller brottsbekämpande myndighet
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom nätverksarkitektur, användar- och trafikfall (t. ex. IP, VoIP, 2-5G Core och RAN)
* Erfarenhet av arbete och uppföljning inom cybersäkerhet eller informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med brottsbekämpande myndigheter
* Dokumentation och arbete enligt tekniska standarder (ETSI, 3GPP mfl)
* Förståelse för hur kryptering används i olika nät och tjänster


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi tar livet på allvar. Hos oss kan du ha ett liv på och utanför jobbet. Mår du bra, mår vi bra. Därför erbjuder vi konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete. Vi har även generöst friskvårdsbidrag och två friskvårdstimmar varje vecka.
   

  

 Dessutom får du förmånliga villkor för lunch, semester, föräldraledighet, pension och vid sjukdom. Här kommer du arbeta i moderna aktivitetsbaserade lokaler på Hälsingegatan 38. Som statlig myndighet erbjuder vi en trygg och stabil arbetsmiljö där du kan känna dig säker. Vi skapar morgondagens samhälle och måste ligga i framkant. Hos oss kommer du att växa med uppgifter hela tiden.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om sex månader. Placering i Stockholm med start snarast möjligt enligt överenskommelse. Din tjänstetitel blir teknisk expert.
   

  

 För att vi ska kunna göra en rättvis och objektiv bedömning av din kompetens ber vi dig att inte inkludera bild, personnummer eller adress i ditt CV. Vi har valt att inte efterfråga personligt brev då vi istället använder urvalsfrågor. Detta för att vi vill lägga fokus på din erfarenhet och kompetens, vilket bidrar till en mer effektiv och rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Tester kommer att ingå i processen. Om du har skyddade uppgifter, vänligen kontakta vår HR-specialist.
   

  

 För ytterligare information, vänligen kontakta enhetschef Johanna Eklund på johanna.eklund@pts.se eller HR-specialist Eva Bennich Rathsman på eva.bennichrathsman@pts.se. För frågor relaterade till våra lokala fackliga arbetstagarorganisationer, vänligen maila till saco@pts.se eller st@pts.se.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 13 maj 2025.
   

  

 Klicka här för att se filmen om oss Vi är PTS

title: Client Director
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 As a Client Director you are main responsible for your clients and a leader for the assigned client team ensuring that you together drive profitability as well as client satisfaction. You will serve as the main point of contact and strategic advisor for your clients and through your deep knowledge of their business as well as Publicis capabilities you’ll help both clients and Publicis business grow. As a Client Director you are leading the client teams and the work carried out on behalf of the client ensuring that the team has the best possible conditions to do a good job.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Client Satisfaction: Responsible for your client portfolio and serve as the main contact for our clients developing the client relationship.
* Employee Satisfaction: Lead your client teams and ensure that your team has the best conditions to do a good job (brief well, build understanding of client’s business, challenges and goals, ensure sufficient time, set client expectations).
* Profitability: Actively working with morebiz, newbiz and efficiency improvements.
* Strategic leadership: Responsible for annual strategies and development of test & learn agendas.
* Responsible for the follow-up, control, and structure of the entire team towards the client, to work smarter and maximize revenue.
* Responsible for client's contracts, processes, guidelines, taxonomy, billing management, etc.
* Responsible for client’s Audits and Cost commits, ensure that actionable strategies are implemented to meet requirements.


**Qualifications**
* 5-10 years working experience from the media and communications industry or equivalent.
* Track record from successfully leading and building strong relationships with clients to develop and grow their business.
* Possess a commercial mindset and thrive on understanding client’s businesses and is skilled at figuring out how to deliver growth for clients.
* Is a skilled self-leader with the ability to successfully lead and support cross disciplined team. Values collaboration and has a collective mindset and enjoy communicating with and motivating people to build high-performing teams.
* Has a solid knowledge of media, digital development, performance, data, technology and creativity.
* Is passionate about strategy and storytelling and is confident and experienced in leading the client's strategic planning process based on their business objectives and translating them into clear, comprehensive communication and media recommendations.
* Has excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.
* Is curious, embrace change and foster a culture of learning and constant development and has the ability to come up with new, innovating thinking.
* Is well organized and perform in a fast-paced environment, under pressure and with tight deadlines.
* Communicates clearly and is fluent in both Swedish and English.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, native user of project management tools is meritorious.
* It is valuable if you have experience working with Nordic and/or global clients and are familiar with the type of inquiries and tasks this entails.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Trading Manager
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
**Are you ready to lead the way in holistic video planning and media product development? We’re seeking an innovative Trading & Video Manager to shape impactful strategies and maximize value for our clients!**
 As a Trading & Video Manager, you will focus strongly on holistic video planning and product development.
   

  

 You will play a key role in ensuring that the agency’s pricing guarantees across all media with cost commitments are met and that our video investments are optimized in accordance with partner agreements and other strategic considerations.
   

  

 You will work closely with client and specialist teams to identify new opportunities and needs, acting as their expert representative in dialogues with the broader Trading & Investment organization. An important part of your work will be to ensure that our video and media products are competitive and meet the long-term goals of both our agency and our clients.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Main responsibilities include:
   

  

* Responsibility for holistic video planning.
* Development of media products.
* Ensuring compliance with the agency’s pricing guarantees (cost commitments across all media) and optimizing video investments based on partner agreements.
* Training specialist managers and client teams on Publicis Media’s video strategy and product portfolio.
* Setting KPIs and following up on and optimizing partnerships across all media and the video product portfolio.
* Participating in strategic and tactical planning with client teams to maximize the use of the video portfolio.
* Contributing to pitches, strategy presentations, and onboarding of new clients with a focus on video.


 You will be part of the Investment & Trading team, with ties to Apex, and are expected to contribute to knowledge sharing and skills development within Publicis Media. In this role, you will collaborate with specialist managers and other stakeholders to ensure that we fulfill our commitments to clients and partners, with a particular focus on video.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 1-3 years of experience in media planning, trading, or video investments, ideally at a media agency or broadcaster.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field preferred.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret data and optimize media investments.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to build effective partnerships.
* Solid understanding of the media landscape, including video and digital trends.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Customer Service Agent Part-Time (Finnish Speaking)
description:
**Who We Are**
 Since our start in 2017 we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the world’s financial health. So far, we’ve helped Swedes, Finns, Norwegians and Germans save millions by refinancing expensive consumer credits.
   

  

 But we aim higher. New markets, new tools, new products and new ways of improving people’s financial lives. This means we need more brains and hearts to fuel our growth. That is why we are currently searching for a Finnish speaking Operations Agent - Part-time.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Being an Operations Agent - Part-time at Anyfin consists of two major areas: Analyzing and evaluating more complicated customer applications to deliver suitable offers. Handling communication with customers via email, phone, chat and social media. We are truly passionate about being on the customers side and creating an outstanding customer experience. As a part of our tightly knit team you will impact the customer and the success of the company on a daily basis. We offer exceptional options to combine the work with studies or another employment. Our working hours are scheduled for afternoons on weekdays AND during weekends. The job offers you the unique possibility to get practical work experience enhancing your ability to find work related solutions as well as working in teams.
   

  

**We Believe You**
* Have excellent communication skills in Finnish and English.
* Are keen to learn and willing to take initiative.
* Are self-motivated, fearless and have a great desire to contribute to the team and spread a positive atmosphere around you.
* We are searching for students at various stages of their education and especially encourage those who are in the early phases of their studies to apply.
* Are willing to work between 10-15 hours/week.


**What We Offer**
 We offer a modern working environment with our office located in the heart of Stockholm. Our team is diverse, comprising professionals from various countries around the world. At Anyfin the idea of personal development has no limit. Growing at a fast pace we offer you the chance to be part of something truly amazing. With strong backers and a world class team there is no limit to what we can achieve together. We were founded with a vision of challenging and transforming an industry that today is not taking into account the people it is supposed to serve.
   

  

 We are making a change. We have built a company of passionate doers with a curious urge to always do things better and smarter. We innovate, build and iterate. We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues.
   

  

 While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: VP Risk Operations
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 As we are building the future of business banking, risk operations are mission-critical to our success. We’re looking for a Vice President of Risk Operations to strategically lead and scale our Credit and Financial Crime (FinCrime) functions. This is a key executive role where you’ll take full ownership of RiskOps domain, set the long-term direction, and build the solid foundations required for sustainable and compliant growth.
   

  

 You’ll be responsible for leading multiple high-impact teams, aligning risk operations with product and commercial strategy, and ensuring we remain compliant, agile, and customer-centric while retaining maximum efficiency by continuously improving processes and automating where possible. This role combines hands-on leadership with long-term strategic thinking, and you’ll be a core member of the executive team helping shape Juni’s future.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing 🏃‍♀️**
* Set and drive the long-term vision and strategy for the RiskOps domain, prioritizing maximal efficiency in all operational processes while ensuring proper risk management.
* Build and lead high-performing, multidisciplinary teams built for scalable operations aligned with Juni's growth
* Collaborate closely with the CEO and Juni’s executive leadership to enhance company-wide decision-making with a strong focus on risk awareness.
* Define and implement scalable, technology-enabled processes to boost operational efficiency, ensuring readiness for regulatory requirements.
* Establish KPIs for portfolio performance, model accuracy, and risk exposure, monitored through advanced analytics dashboards.
* Act as the primary liaison for regulators, auditors, and investors regarding risk analytics and reporting, ensuring transparent and compliant practices


 Credit Risk Strategy & Oversight
   

  

* Develop and lead an enterprise-wide risk management strategy for digital lending, using data and predictive analytics to balance growth with stability
* Act as a strategic advisor to the CEO and Board on risk appetite, integrating macroeconomic trends and scenario modeling into decision-making
* Oversee the design and evolution of AI- and ML-powered credit underwriting frameworks to enable real-time, risk-aligned, and automated decisioning
* Guide the development of early warning systems and Credit Monitoring strategies to preserve portfolio health and detect emerging risks
* Own and scale our Collections strategy, focusing on intelligent segmentation, automation, and customer experience in recovery


 Financial Crime Strategy & Oversight
   

  

* Making sure that the general risk assessment is updated to accurately reflect the product and customer risk and implemented in customer scoring- and transaction monitoring models.
* Develop the full FinCrime lifecycle strategy - screening, onboarding, monitoring, investigations, escalations as well as management and regulatory reporting.
* Ensure our KYB and AML processes are efficient, automated where possible, and compliant with evolving regulations
* Lead SAR governance and reporting processes, ensuring accurate and timely filings with the appropriate authorities


 Operational Excellence & Risk Infrastructure
   

  

* Design and scale risk operations infrastructure to support regulatory licensing and banking readiness
* Collaborate closely with Product, Compliance, Data, Engineering, and Commercial to ensure end-to-end alignment
* Stay ahead of regulatory developments and emerging risks across Europe and globally


**Qualifications 👑**
* Bachelor's degree in a numeric field, e.g. Finance, Economics, Econometrics or related field (MBA or relevant master's degree preferred)
* 10+ years of experience in Risk Operations within fintech, banking, or financial services, with at least 5 years in senior leadership roles
* Deep expertise in both Credit Risk and Financial Crime, including regulatory frameworks (AMLD, KYB, PSD2, etc.)
* Proven experience scaling operational teams and systems in high-growth, fast-paced environments
* Strategic thinker with a strong execution mindset—able to drive change while maintaining day-to-day excellence
* Exceptional leadership and people development skills with a track record of building resilient, empowered teams
* Data-driven decision-maker with strong analytical capabilities and a deep understanding of risk-reward tradeoffs
* Excellent communicator, capable of aligning executive stakeholders, regulators, and cross-functional teams


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation. 30 days. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Affärs- & Verksamhetskonsult inom betalningar
job_function: Consulting, Business Development, and Project Management
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Vill du jobba med utvecklande uppdrag jämsides med erfarna och kunniga inom Bank- & Finansbranschen?** 




  





 Midagon är en nordisk, oberoende verksamhets- och IT-konsultfirma specialiserad på att genomföra utmanande transformationsprojekt och program. Vi är över 200 anställda i Norden, varav närmare 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer, där vi kan stoltsera med långa kundrelationer samt flertalet egna ramavtal.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bred bakgrund inom bank, pension och försäkring med fokus på bland annat verksamhetsutveckling, projekt- & programledning eller specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), 8 års certifiering av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora konsulter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Som Affärs- och verksamhetskonsult kommer du att ingå i affärsområdet
 *Bank & Insurance* 
 som består av ett tiotal konsulter av varierande roller inom Bank, Finans, Liv & Pension. Du kommer med din expertis fungera som en oberoende rådgivare och bidrar till att kunden når sina affärsmål och står väl rustad för framtida utmaningar. Vi fokuserar på kompetensutbyte och varje persons vilja att utvecklas och tillämpar ett coachande förhållningssätt genom att vara varandras bästa bollplank mot våra olika branschfrågor för att utvecklas gemensamt.
 



  





**Den vi söker** 




 Nu söker vi fler kollegor som brinner för att utveckla processer inom bank, regelanpassning och speciellt betalområdet hos våra kunder. Vi ser att du har mångårig erfarenhet inom finansbranschen och har arbetat strategiskt inom betallösningar samt erfarenhet av affärsanalys, målbildsarbete, processutveckling, produktägarskap eller förändringsledning.
 



**Som person ser vi att du har:** 



* Har mångårig konsulterfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av affärsanalys, målbildsarbete och processutveckling inom betalningslösningar
* God förmåga av att leda och driva projekt i olika organisationsnivåer med ansvar för strategisk som operativ process- och förändringsarbeten
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



  





  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer om oss och Våra tidigare uppdrag, på hemsidan kan du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin Nilsson inom HR-& rekrytering på martin.nilsson@midagon.com / 070-2257833 eller vår Head of people and culture, Hanna Fredriksson på hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com / 076-0074551.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Lead Account Executive – Stockholm (Sweden)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Financial Services
description:
**What does a Lead Account Executive do?**
***Emphasis***
* Key
+ Lead our Swedish Sales Team consisting of both business developers and account executives
+ Achieve predetermined budget
+ Generate ARR/customer growth


* Development
+ Scale your business together with the team in a sustainable way
+ Protect/breath the team-and company culture (cfr. the way we do things)
+ Motivate and inspire your team to achieve and surpass their goals and reach an overall high level of performance (raising the bar)


**Responsibilities**
* Market Leadership
+ Grow the market footprint
+ Ensure that each local customer becomes an ambassador and generates opportunities using all available resources;
+ Actively contribute to the implementation/adjustment of the regional strategy and execute it at fast pace using a mix of sales and marketing levers;
+ Work closely with other teams to deliver market insights, help identify and address business/product priorities and enable BrightAnalytics to stay ahead of the market;
+ Maintain gameplans, playbooks and other content to make winning strategies scalable.


* Revenue generation
+ Reach regional team budget
+ Make sure revenue team members reach their ARR targets
+ Forecast revenue and potential business growth in the region;
+ Responsible for regional pipeline (fuel + follow up)
+ Put sufficient emphasis on the importance of pipeline management (lead by example)


* Lead generation
+ Make sure our Business Development Team generates enough leads via combined business-marketing development actions to fuel our sales pipe;
+ Monitor lead quality and manage our lead pipeeline
+ Maintain- and expand our partner network
+ Detect new market opportunities


***People***
* Recruitment
+ Hire, train, lead and retain a top-performing team


* Onboarding
+ Manage/ support the onboarding process in line with the onboarding plan


* Coaching/training
+ Act as a coach to ensure that our global processes and best practices are being adopted in an efficient way
+ Protect/breath the team-and company culture (cfr. the way we do things)
+ Motivate and inspire your team to achieve and surpass their goals and reach an overall high level of performance (raising the bar)
+ Approach: shadow sessions, roleplays, call/ meeting analysis, recap sessions, pop up quizzes
+ Test/monitor knowledge on a permanent basis
+ Expand knowledge when needed


**Who are you?**
* Masters degree in business
* +/- 5 years experience in a business/people/sales role
* Fluency in Swedish is essential due to the platform’s complexity, and fluency in English is a must in our international environment;
* Highly people oriented
* Ambitious, energized and target oriented


**What can you expect from us?**
* You will be part of driven, dynamic and enthusiastic team in a varied job;
* Weekly internal training sessions and on-the-job coaching will teach you unique skills that will serve you well throughout your career;
* We are a financially healthy scale-up with international growth ambitions;
* We have an open business culture with room for personal initiative;
* A competitive salary & motivating bonus system.

title: Datadriven Affärsutvecklare
description:
*Länsförsäkringar befinner sig i en expansiv fas där transformationen mot en alltmer datadriven verksamhet präglar all vår utveckling. Vill du vara med i en förflyttning där du sitter nära verksamheten och har möjlighet att påverka våra affärsbeslut? Som Sveriges största försäkringsbolag inom sakförsäkring så sitter vi på stora mängder outforskade data som bara väntar på att ge oss nya insikter. Anta utmaningen nu och få Sveriges bästa kollegor i nyrenoverade och fräscha lokaler på Tegeluddsvägen.*
**Om jobbet**
 Aktuarie & Analys är en del av Affärsenhet Sak med uppdrag att leverera aktuariella och analytiska tjänster samt beslutstöd kopplat till länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär. Avdelningen har en central roll i den pågående transformationen.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Affärsutvecklare som kommer att leda utvecklingsinitiativ (epics) inom prissättning, lönsamhetsstyrning, dataintegration och beslutstöd. Uppdraget som Epic Owner kommer att spela en avgörande roll för att vi ska nå våra högt satta mål och framgångsrikt driva förändring inom organisationen. Du kommer att identifiera behov och omfattning av förändring, skapa en tydlig färdplan och utveckla välgrundade beslutsunderlag. Du kommer att vara en länk mellan oss på Aktuarie & Analys och våra intressenter, säkerställa kommunikation och att vi tillsammans arbetar i rätt riktning.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden kommer vara att:
   

  

* Leda och facilitera arbetet med att detaljera utvecklingsinitiativ och sammanställa bedömning av deras värde för portföljstyrningen.
* Säkerställa att risker identifieras och analyseras enligt beslutade processer och styrdokument.
* Ansvara för nedbrytning av epics till features och prioritering i relevanta backlogs.
* Koordinera aktiviteter rörande epics med inblandade portföljer, lean-agila tåg och utvecklingsteam samt säkerställa dialog och samverkan mellan intressenter och specialister.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som brinner för affär och dess möjlighet att dra nytta av ny teknik. Du har relevant akademisk examen och erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsinitiativ. Genom din erfarenhet har du god förståelse för den tekniska förflyttning som genomförs och är van att ha dialog med IT-arkitekter och andra specialister. Du trivs med att växla perspektivet från det strategiska till det mer operativa.
   

  

 Som Affärsutvecklare och Epic Owner ser vi att du har förmågan att analysera och förklara komplexa affärsproblem, utveckla effektiva lösningar och fatta väl avvägda beslut. Du behöver kunna planera och samordna arbetet och samarbeta med olika avdelningar. Vidare är det viktigt att du har en god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift. För att vara framgångsrik tror vi även att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta inom en liknande organisation och att driva lean-agil affärsutveckling och förändringsledning, gärna utifrån SAFe-ramverket.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en inspirerande och stimulerande roll där du blir en nyckelspelare i vår spännande resa mot en alltmer datadriven verksamhet. Detta är en chans att sätta din prägel på och förverkliga LFAB-koncernens framtidsvision. Du kommer att bli del av ett dynamiskt och professionellt team inom Affärsutveckling. Här kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med likasinnade experter som delar din passion för innovation och förändring. Ta steget och bli en del av vår spännande framtidsresa!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-25**

title: Network Development Engineer, InfraComms
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services is looking for a highly motivated and technically savvy Network Development Engineer to help operate, develop and scale one of the world’s largest and most complex networks.
   

  

 Come join the InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a Network Development Engineer (NDE).
   

  

 The InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) is responsible for managing the communication, coordination, and operations related to external networks and carriers.
   

  

 The team maintains balanced partnerships with key industry stakeholders, leveraging their technical expertise to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex network related issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively.
   

  

 The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and theory. They will have experience proactively managing engineering projects, network optimization initiatives and operational network support for a large-scale service provider.
   

  

 As a technical leader, you will manage complex stakeholder operational issues, relationships and develop innovative mechanisms and solutions to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is essential! This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world-class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 As an NDE in the InfraComms team, you will be responsible for:
   

  

 Handling both reactive and proactive operational issues related to AWS's external network services such as PNI, Public Peering, Transit, Embedd Caches, and Backbone.
   

  

 Engaging in advanced triaging for critical services and maintaining ownership of troubleshooting and communication.
   

  

 You will also enhance and develop mechanism to further improve AWS network processes for a better availability and connectivity.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The InfraComms team is composed of experts in the internet ecosystem, with comprehensive knowledge of interconnectivity layers.
   

  

 The team operates on a 24x5 schedule across EU/NA/AP regions, ensuring a superior experience for AWS internal and external customers.
   

  

 You will be working alongside a diverse group of Network Development Engineers from the AMER, APAC, and EMEA regions.
   

  

 By joining the InfraComms team, you will play a crucial role in enhancing AWS's network operations and business development strategies, directly contributing to the improvement of internet infrastructure and the customer experience.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree from in Computer Science or related area.
* Experience with major routing protocols, specifically BGP.
* Experience of optical transport (passive and active Layer 1/WDM) operations and networks, auutomation via Bash/Shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.


**Preferred Qualifications**
 - Master’s degree from in Computer Science or related area -
   

  

* Experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks.
* Experience in routing protocols, network operation and/ or implementation.
* Experience in fiber-optical network designing.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A2926204

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
* Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.



  





**Skills We're Looking For:** 




  




* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
* Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.



  





**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Endpoint Engineer
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As an
 **Endpoint Engineer** 
 , you will be responsible for managing and supporting endpoint devices, including hardware, software, and network components, ensuring they operate smoothly and securely. You will install, diagnose, repair, maintain, and upgrade core systems while providing end-user training and support.
   

  

 This role requires collaboration with application and infrastructure teams to analyze and resolve system failures. You will be part of a global IT team, working with colleagues across different countries.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* End-User Support & Troubleshooting
* Respond to incoming ticketing system requests for hardware, software, and networking issues.
* Perform on-site and remote diagnosis, analysis, and resolution of complex technical problems.
* Install, configure, test, maintain, and troubleshoot: End-user workstations (Windows/macOS), Networked peripheral devices (printers, scanners, etc.), and Corporate mobile devices (iOS & Android).
* Provide technical documentation and "how-to" guides for end users.
* Work with end users to define and meet PC service level agreements (SLAs).
* Hardware & Software Management
* Recommend and implement corrective hardware solutions, including off-site repairs when needed, adhering to infrastructure processes, procedures, and methodologies.
* Conduct hardware lifecycle analysis, ensuring timely device refresh and inventory management.
* Manage software deployment, patching, and updates across endpoints.
* Maintain and troubleshoot enterprise software tools such as Microsoft Intune, SCCM, and Jamf.
* Mobile Device & macOS Management
* Deploy and manage corporate mobile devices (iOS & Android) using MDM solutions such as: Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro and Samsung Knox.
* Configure and support MacBook devices in enterprise environments, ensuring compliance with company IT policies.
* Set up and maintain Apple Business Manager (ABM) for macOS and iOS device management.
* Security & Compliance
* Ensure endpoint security compliance with company policies and industry regulations
* Implement endpoint security tools, including: Antivirus & anti-malware solutions, Device encryption (BitLocker, FileVault), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) solutions (e.g., Duo, Microsoft Authenticator), DLP Solutions.
* Apply patch management and security updates to protect against vulnerabilities.
* Enforce Mobile Application Management (MAM) policies for secure corporate app access.
* Collaboration & Training
* Provide technical training and guidance to end users and staff.
* Liaise with vendors for hardware/software troubleshooting and warranty management.
* Work closely with cybersecurity and infrastructure teams to improve endpoint security.


**Your Profile**
**Required Skills & Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in an endpoint support/engineering role.
* Hands-on experience with tools and technologies such as: Active Directory (AD), DNS, DHCP, VPN, SCCM, Intune, Entra/Azure AD, Jamf Pro, Apple Business Manager, Duo, Samsung Knox.
* Strong troubleshooting, problem-solving, and analytic skills.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a global team.
* Team player with a go-to attitude, honest, engaging, and highly adaptable.
* Customer service-oriented with a proactive mindset and strong communication skills—both verbal and written.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English (required).


**Preferred/Bonus Skills**
 Experience with automation and scripting for device management:
   

  

* Windows: PowerShell, SCCM task sequences, Group Policy scripting
* macOS/Linux: Python, Bash, AppleScript, Jamf automation
* Cloud: Microsoft Graph API, Ansible, Puppet, Chef


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered
 **hybrid,** 
 which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.

title: Handläggare – arbeta som Nato-samordnare i Regeringskansliet
description:
**Förvaltningschefens kansli, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
 Är du en drivande person som har god kunskap om säkerhetsskyddslagen? Trivs du med att koordinera komplexa frågor och att verka på olika nivåer i en verksamhet? Då är du kanske den vi söker till rollen som Nato-samordnare i Regeringskansliet. Vi erbjuder dig en central och variationsrik roll med många kontaktytor i en utvecklande och händelserik miljö.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.** 
 Som Nato-samordnare bidrar du till att de förväntningar som det svenska medlemskapet i Nato medför uppfylls. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår att driva och stödja olika delar av myndighetens arbete med Natorelaterade frågor och aktiviteter. Kärnan i arbetet består i att analysera olika sakförhållanden och utifrån det utarbeta och driva förslag om förbättringar och utvecklingsmöjligheter. Det kan även förekomma andra arbetsuppgifter inom sektionens ansvarsområden såsom krisberedskap och krishantering.
   

  

 Förvaltningschefens kansli är en stabsfunktion inom Förvaltningsavdelningen (FCK FA). Sektionens uppdrag är att stödja förvaltningschefen bland annat genom att samordna, vidareutveckla och stödja i den årliga planerings- och uppföljningsprocessen för Förvaltningsavdelningen.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se
   

  

**Din bakgrund** 
 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant. Du har erfarenhet av liknande arbete inom statlig sektor och vana av att samarbeta och kommunicera på olika nivåer i en verksamhet. Du behöver ha god kännedom om säkerhetsskyddslagen och säkerhetsskyddsförordningen.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta processorienterat och med verksamhetsutveckling. Att ha arbetat med krisberedskap och krishantering samt kännedom om Nordatlantiska fördraget är också det meriterande.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen krävs att du är initiativtagande och uthålligt kan driva ditt uppdrag framåt. Du är en stabil person som samarbetar väl med personer på alla nivåer och med olika yrkeskategorier både internt och externt.
   

  

 I en politiskt styrd organisation med en händelserik omvärld får du vara beredd på det oförutsedda och du förväntas kunna leverera snabbt, vilket ställer krav på din flexibilitet. I ditt arbete är du kvalitetsmedveten och uttrycker dig väl både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets medarbetarkriterier är helhet, utveckling, resultat. Alla som arbetar i Regeringskansliet behöver ha helhetssyn och samarbeta för verksamhetens bästa. Du förväntas bidra med ditt perspektiv och din kompetens samt vara öppen för andras. Du kommer med idéer och nya angreppssätt för att förbättra och utveckla verksamheten och din egen kompetens. Du är inriktad på resultat i ditt agerande och anpassar dig när behov och inriktning ändras.
   

  

 Läs mer på: Medarbetarskap och ledarskap i Regeringskansliet - Regeringen.se
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning. Regeringskansliet tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

 Tjänsteresor kan förekomma. Stor vikt kommer läggas vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta sektionschef Annika Ström på 08-405 42 48. Fackliga representanter är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Jan Wahlström för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den 1 maj 2025.**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: DevOps Tekniker
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som är redo att ta sig an uppdrag för våra kunder.
   

  

 Du får arbeta med spännande projekt, både på plats och på distans, och vara en del av ett starkt team. Vi erbjuder utvecklingsmöjligheter, förmåner som föräldralön och aktieprogram, samt en flexibel arbetsmiljö
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du som konsult för våra kunder som behöver din expertis inom DevOps Våra kunder är stora företag eller organisationer inom offentlig sekor. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande, men sträcker sig från nyutveckling till förvaltning. Du förväntas arbeta både hands-on och praktiskt, men även med analys, planering och strategi.
   

  

 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund, på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, det beror på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter har en hybridlösning, där man varierar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Här behöver du några års arbetsliverfarenhet inom relevant område.
   

  

* Du har erfarenhet av DevOps antingen genom dina eftergymnasiala IT-utbildning alternativt har du förskaffat dig erfarenheten genom din arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Kubernetes eller Docker
* AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Plattform
* Linux
* CI/CD


 Som konsult är det viktigt att man är flexibel och gillar att möta och samarbeta med nya personer. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper som exempelvis nyfikenhet, kreativitet, promblemlösningsförmåga. Man behöver också en positiv inställnig och man trivs med att arbeta med ett stort kundfokus
   

  

**To applicants: Please note that this position requires both Swedish and English language skills on a professional level, verbally as well as in writing.**
 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Övrigt
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Junior Data Governance Specialist till Swedavia
description:
**Är du i början av din karriär eller tar din examen innan sommaren? Vill du vara med och utveckla hur Swedavia tar nästa steg inom informationshantering?**
**Du kommer att arbeta inom enheten Data Governance med ansvar för att säkerställa noggrannheten, integriteten och tillförlitligheten hos våra informationstillgångar. Enheten och teamet arbetar med att skapa strukturer, förutsättningar, regler och riktlinjer för Swedavias information och hur den ska hanteras på ett korrekt och säkert sätt.**
**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Rollen innebär att du blir en mellanhand mellan IT och våra informationsanvändare. Avdelningen ansvarar även för att driva verksamhetsförvaltningen av Swedavias operativa systemstöd och att hjälpa till med beslutande utvecklingsinsatser inom området. Genom samarbete och samordning är målet att vidareutveckla och säkerställa att verksamhetens system levererar högsta möjliga värde.
   

  

 I befattningen ingår även att stötta Data Governance Manager samt enhetschef BI i uppsättning av strukturer kring processer för Swedavias informationsstyrning.
   

  

 I rollen ligger ansvarsområden såsom;
